蝑蕭?:
參考答案
A. 氧氣 (O₂)
A. Oxygen (O₂)

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
直接穿越磷脂雙分子層的條件
只有 小型、非極性分子 可以自由擴散通過。
Only small, non-polar molecules can directly diffuse through the phospholipid bilayer.

各選項物質的通道

氧氣 (O₂) → 非極性分子 ⇒ 可直接通過磷脂雙層 → 屬於 X。
Oxygen (O₂): non-polar molecule ⇒ can diffuse directly through bilayer ⇒ represents X.
葡萄糖 (C₆H₁₂O₆) → 大型極性分子 ⇒ 需透過 葡萄糖轉運蛋白 (carrier protein) 運送 → 屬於 Y。
Glucose: large polar molecule ⇒ requires carrier protein transport ⇒ represents Y.
水 (H₂O) → 小型極性分子 ⇒ 雖然體積小，但主要透過 水通道蛋白 (aquaporin) 運輸 → 屬於 Z。
Water (H₂O): small polar molecule ⇒ mainly crosses via aquaporins ⇒ represents Z.
結論
答案是 A. 氧氣，因為只有它能自由穿越磷脂雙層。
Correct answer: A. Oxygen, since only O₂ can freely diffuse across the bilayer.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

大分子或極性分子（如葡萄糖） → 需要載體蛋白 (carrier proteins)。
Large or polar molecules (e.g. glucose) → need carrier proteins.
小極性分子（如水） → 依靠通道蛋白 (channel proteins, e.g. aquaporins)。
Small polar molecules (e.g. water) → rely on channel proteins.
小非極性分子（如 O₂、CO₂） → 才能直接穿過脂雙層。
Small non-polar molecules (e.g. O₂, CO₂) → can cross freely through lipid bilayer.

第 2 題 (DNA 鹼基配對)
參考答案
C. 只有 (2) 和 (3)
C. Only (2) and (3)

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
(1) DNA 是螺旋型
與鹼基比例無直接關係。
Helical shape of DNA does not explain base ratio.

(2) DNA 是雙鏈分子
兩條鏈互補配對，A 與 T，C 與 G。
DNA is double-stranded, with complementary base pairing of A–T and C–G.

(3) 含氮鹼基互補配對
A 與 T 配對，C 與 G 配對 → A+C=50% 說明互補規律。
A pairs with T, C with G → A + C = 50% fits complementary rule.

✅ 正確是 (2)、(3)。
Correct: (2) and (3).

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

Chargaff’s rule：A=T, C=G。
Chargaff’s rule: A=T, C=G.
DNA 為「雙鏈 + 互補配對」。
DNA is “double-stranded + complementary pairing”.
「螺旋形態」與比例無關。
Helical structure unrelated to base ratios.

第 3 題 (孟德爾分離定律)
參考答案
A. 等位基因；第一次減數細胞分裂
A. Alleles; Meiosis I

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
現代理解的遺傳因子
孟德爾的「因子」= 等位基因。
Mendel’s “factors” = alleles.

等位基因的分離
位於同源染色體上，在 減 I 同源分離時分開。
Alleles are on homologous chromosomes, separated in Meiosis I.

為何不是減 II?
減 II 分裂姐妹染色單體，非等位基因。
Meiosis II separates sister chromatids, not alleles.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

分離定律= 等位基因在減 I 分離。
Law of segregation = alleles segregate in Meiosis I.
獨立分配定律= 減 I 不同染色體獨立分配。
Law of independent assortment = chromosomes assort independently in Meiosis I.

第 4 題 (體細胞染色體數目)
參考答案
B. 4
B. 4

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
題幹提示：「有兩對同源染色體」= 2n = 4。
Question states: “two pairs of homologous chromosomes” = 2n = 4.

體細胞是二倍體 → 染色體數目 = 4。
Somatic cells are diploid → chromosome number = 4.

染色體計算：不論是否複製，X 形結構仍計為 1 條。
Chromosome count is independent of replication; an X-shaped structure counts as one chromosome.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

Chromosome ≠ Chromatid!
看「同源對數」推算 2n。
減 I 前染色體複製 → 含 2 個姐妹染色單體。
Chromosome ≠ chromatid; count homologous pairs; replicated X still = 1 chromosome.

第 5 題 (減數分裂排列)
參考答案
B
B

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
減 I 中期特徵
同源染色體成對排列在赤道板。
Metaphase I: homologous chromosomes (bivalents) line up at equator.

檢視選項

A/C/D：並非呈對，只顯示單條 → 錯。
A/C/D: show single chromosomes, not pairs → incorrect.
B：同源染色體以對排列 → 正確。
B: homologous chromosomes paired at equator → correct.
📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

減 I 中期 → 同源成對。
Meiosis I metaphase → homologous pairs.
減 II 中期 → 單條染色體。
Meiosis II metaphase → single chromosomes.

參考答案
D. S
D. S

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
單卵雙生兒基因完全相同
如果某特徵完全由基因控制，相似度應該是 100%。
Identical twins have exactly the same genes. If a trait is entirely determined by genes, the similarity should be 100%.

特徵分析

P, Q：單卵雙生兒相似度接近 100% → 幾乎完全受基因控制。
P, Q: similarity close to 100% → almost entirely genetic.
R：單卵雙生兒相似度約 90%，但仍高於二卵雙生兒 → 基因影響大，環境影響中等。
R: similarity ≈ 90%, higher than fraternal twins → mainly genetic, partly environmental.
S：單卵雙生兒相似度只有 ~80%，比其他三項低 → 環境因素影響最大。
S: similarity only ~80%, the lowest among traits → most influenced by environment.
結論
特徵 S 最受環境影響。
Trait S is the most affected by environmental factors.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

相似度接近 100% → 基因決定。
Similarity close to 100% → determined by genes.
相似度 <100%（即使在單卵雙生兒） → 有環境影響。
Similarity < 100% (even in identical twins) → environmental effect exists.
用「誰的相似度最低？」判斷「環境因素影響最大」。
The lowest similarity → strongest environmental influence.

第 7 題 (親緣關係)
參考答案
C. X 與 Z 的親緣關係較 X 與 Y 近
C. X is more closely related to Z than to Y

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
細胞壁 ≠ 原核獨有 → 植物/真菌也有。
Cell wall ≠ prokaryote only → plants and fungi too.

相似度：

X–Y: 45%
X–Z: 55% → 更相似。
X–Y: 45%; X–Z: 55% → closer relation.
相似度高 → 親緣近。
Higher similarity → closer relation.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

用蛋白序列相似度判斷親緣。
細胞壁不是可靠的分類特徵。
Protein sequence similarity = phylogenetic closeness; cell wall not a reliable marker.

第 8 題 (分解者與演替)
參考答案
D. 以銨化合物的形式，將氮釋放回土壤
D. Release nitrogen back into the soil in the form of ammonium compounds

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
分解者將含氮有機物分解 → 釋放 銨離子 (NH₄⁺) → 氨化作用。
Decomposers break down nitrogenous organics → release NH₄⁺ → ammonification.

植物吸收 NH₄⁺/NO₃⁻ → 合成蛋白質 → 推動生態演替。
Plants absorb NH₄⁺/NO₃⁻ → build proteins → drive succession.

其他選項

A：岩石風化 → 非分解者功能。
Rock weathering → not decomposers.
B：清除死有機物表面正確，但與演替關連不足。
Removal of dead matter insufficient for succession.
C：釋放 CO₂ 屬呼吸作用。
CO₂ release is respiration.
D：正確 → 銨化合物釋放，推動群落發展。
Correct → ammonium release drives community growth.
📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

關鍵字：氨化作用 (ammonification)。
Keyword: ammonification
有機氮 → NH₄⁺ → 硝化菌 → NO₂⁻/NO₃⁻。
Organic N → NH₄⁺ → nitrification → NO₂⁻/NO₃⁻.
出題常連結「演替」與「分解者氮循環」。
Questions link “succession” with “decomposers in nitrogen cycle”.
📘 全部第 2–8 題 已整理完成，中英對照、逐步解釋+考試提醒。
老師要不要我幫你做一個 統一標頭模板（例如：題號、答案、解釋、提醒四部分自動排版），方便整本題解保持格式一致？

參考答案
C. 只有 (2) 和 (3)
C. Only (2) and (3)

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
選項 (1)：昆蟲平均分布在樹上
題目沒有提供昆蟲數量的分布資料，我們只知道「不同鳥在捕食不同區域的昆蟲」，並不能推論昆蟲分布是平均的。
The question does not provide data on insect distribution. We only know that different birds feed in different zones, but this does not mean insects are evenly distributed.
→ (1) ❌ 錯 / Incorrect

選項 (2)：鳥 A、B、C 具有不同生態位
生態位不僅指「地點」，還包括一個物種在生態系統的角色與資源利用方式。因為 A、B、C 棲息於同一棵樹，但分利用不同區域 → 它們的生態位不同。
A niche refers to the habitat, role, and interactions of a species within an ecosystem. Since A, B, and C exploit different parts of the same tree, they have different niches.
→ (2) ✅ 正確 / Correct

選項 (3)：種間競爭較小
由於三種鳥分開覓食，資源利用重疊減少，因此它們之間的競爭壓力較低。
Because the three bird species feed in different zones, their resource overlap is reduced, so interspecific competition is smaller.
→ (3) ✅ 正確 / Correct

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

生態位 (niche) = 棲息地 + 資源利用方式 + 在生態系統中的角色。
Niche = habitat + resource use + ecological role.
不同物種若在相同棲地利用不同資源 → 降低種間競爭。
Different species using different resources in the same habitat → reduced interspecific competition.
題目沒有提到「昆蟲分布平均」→ 類似的推論要避免。
If not directly stated, don’t assume even distribution of insects.

參考答案
D. 偏利共生 (Commensalism)
D. Commensalism

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
題目觀察

單獨生活時：X 的數量緩慢上升，Y 的數量幾乎不變。
In solitary living: X increases slowly, Y almost constant.
一同生活時：X 的數量增長明顯加快，而 Y 的數量仍保持不變。
In co-living: X grows faster, while Y remains unchanged.
生態關係判斷

互利共生 (Mutualism)：雙方都得益 → 不符合，因為 Y 沒有明顯益處。
Mutualism: both benefit → incorrect, since Y shows no benefit.
捕食 (Predation)：一方受益，另一方受害 → 不符合，Y 沒有受害。
Predation: one benefits, the other harmed → not the case, Y is unharmed.
競爭 (Competition)：雙方受害 → 不符合。
Competition: both harmed → not the case.
偏利共生 (Commensalism)：一方受益，另一方不受影響 → 完全符合。
Commensalism: one benefits, the other unaffected → matches perfectly.
結論
X 因 Y 的存在受益，數量明顯增加；但 Y 沒受影響 → 偏利共生。
X benefits from Y’s presence, population increases significantly; Y is unaffected → Commensalism.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

互利 (Mutualism)：+ / +
偏利 (Commensalism)：+ / 0
寄生 / 捕食 (Parasitism / Predation)：+ / –
競爭 (Competition)：– / –
👉 在圖題裡常用「種群數目變化」判斷：若只有一方曲線上升，另一方維持不變 → 偏利共生。
👉 In graph questions, use “population trend” to judge: if only one rises while the other stays flat → it’s commensalism.

參考答案
B. 裝置 P：往左移；裝置 Q：沒有變化
B. Apparatus P: moves to the left; Apparatus Q: no change

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
裝置 P (Apparatus P)
種子呼吸作用 → 消耗 O₂，釋放 CO₂。
但裝置中加入了 CO₂ 吸收劑，因此釋放的二氧化碳被吸收。
整體效果：氣體總體積 減少 → 試管內氣壓降低 → 顏色液往左移。
Seeds respire → consume O₂, release CO₂. But the CO₂ absorber removes released CO₂. Net effect = total gas volume decreases → pressure drops inside tube → colored liquid moves left.
裝置 Q (Apparatus Q)
種子同樣進行呼吸作用：吸收 O₂, 釋放 CO₂。
但底部只有水 → 沒有移除 CO₂。
結果：吸收的 O₂ 體積 = 產生的 CO₂ 體積 → 氣體總體積沒有淨變化 → 顏色液保持不變。
Seeds also respire: absorb O₂, release CO₂. But with water only, CO₂ is not removed. Thus O₂ uptake = CO₂ output → no net change in gas volume → liquid stays still.
📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

若 有 CO₂ 吸收劑 → 總氣體體積減少 → 顏色液移動。
With CO₂ absorber → net gas volume decreases → movement of liquid.
若 沒有 CO₂ 吸收劑 → 吸氧與排二氧化碳平衡 → 體積無淨變化。
Without CO₂ absorber → O₂ uptake balanced by CO₂ release → no net change.
液體往哪邊移？記得：氣體總體積減少 → 液體往種子方向（左）移動。
Direction of movement: gas volume decreases → liquid moves toward seeds side (left).

參考答案
B. 萌發中的種子 + 石灰水
B. Germinating seeds + limewater

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
題目核心
想要「顯示呼吸作用中產生的氣體」，最合適的方式是檢測 二氧化碳 (CO₂)。
The task is to show which apparatus can demonstrate the gas produced during respiration. The key gas to detect is carbon dioxide (CO₂).

各裝置分析

A：氧氣吸收劑
只能去除 O₂，無法顯示種子釋放的 CO₂。
Removes O₂ only, does not show CO₂ production.
B：石灰水 (limewater)
呼吸釋放的 CO₂ 會使 石灰水由無色變成乳白色 → 可直接檢驗 CO₂。
Respired CO₂ turns limewater from clear to milky → direct evidence of CO₂.
C：已煮熟的種子 + 二氧化碳吸收劑
煮熟的種子不再呼吸 → 不產生氣體。
Boiled seeds cannot respire → no CO₂ produced.
D：已煮熟的種子 + 水
同樣因種子失活 → 不會有氣體產生。
Boiled seeds = dead, no respiration → no gas production.
結論
唯有 B 能清楚顯示呼吸作用產生的 CO₂。
Only B visibly shows CO₂ release during respiration.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

石灰水 (Limewater) → 檢測 CO₂ 的標準試劑。
Limewater → the standard test for CO₂.
煮熟種子 = 作對照組 (control)，因為不呼吸、不產生 CO₂。
Boiled seeds = control group, no respiration, no CO₂.
氣體檢測題常用對照：萌發種子 (active respiration) vs 煮熟種子 (no respiration)。
Always compare germinating seeds vs boiled seeds for respiration gas tests.

參考答案
B. 棒形圖 (Bar chart)
B. Bar chart

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
題目重點
表格顯示不同糖類被酵母呼吸後，10 分鐘內產生的二氧化碳平均量。題目要求選出 最適合呈現這些數據的圖表。
The table shows different sugars and the average amount of CO₂ produced by yeast respiration over 10 minutes. The question asks: which graph best represents the data?

各圖檢視 (Options analysis)

A 折線圖 (Line graph)
折線圖適合顯示「變化趨勢或隨時間變化」，但這裡只是不同受質間的比較，沒有所謂的時間序列。
Line graphs are for showing changes over time or continuous trends. Here we are only comparing different substrates, so it’s not suitable.
B 棒形圖 (Bar chart)
棒形圖可以清晰比較不同糖類所產生的 CO₂ 平均量 → 最佳選擇。
Bar charts clearly compare discrete categories (sugars) and their CO₂ values → best choice.
C 帶趨勢線的折線圖
類似 A，也暗示「趨勢相關」，但受質種類之間沒有連續關係。
Same issue as A: implying a continuous trend where none exists.
D 圓餅圖 (Pie chart)
用於顯示比例分佈，而不是各數據的實際數值比較 → 不適合。
Pie charts show proportions, not actual values across categories → not suitable.
結論
欲比較不同受質的實驗結果 → 棒形圖 (Bar chart) 最清楚。
To compare CO₂ amounts across different substrates → Bar chart is the clearest option.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

棒形圖 (Bar chart) → 比較類別數據 (categorical data) 最佳。
Bar charts → best for comparing categorical data.
折線圖 (Line graph) → 適合顯示「連續數據隨時間的變化」。
Line graphs → best for continuous data changing over time.
圓餅圖 (Pie chart) → 適合顯示「百分比分配」。
Pie charts → best for showing percentage distribution.

參考答案
A. 細胞質 (Cytoplasm)
A. Cytoplasm

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
問題重點
題目探討的是酵母的 缺氧呼吸 (anaerobic respiration / fermentation)。
The question is about anaerobic respiration (fermentation) in yeast.

缺氧呼吸過程 (Anaerobic respiration process)

發生地點：細胞質 (cytoplasm)。
Occurs entirely in the cytoplasm.
過程：
葡萄糖經 糖酵解 (glycolysis) → 產生 丙酮酸鹽 (pyruvate)。
Glucose undergoes glycolysis → produces pyruvate.
在缺氧條件下：丙酮酸鹽被轉化為 乙醇 (ethanol) + CO₂。
Under anaerobic conditions: pyruvate → ethanol + CO₂.
其他選項錯誤原因 (Why other options are wrong)

B. 細胞膜 (Cell membrane) → 不是產生 CO₂ 的主要位置。
Not the site of CO₂ production.
C. 線粒體基質 (Mitochondrial matrix) → 有氧呼吸中克雷氏循環 (Krebs cycle) 才會產生 CO₂。
CO₂ is produced here only in aerobic respiration (Krebs cycle).
D. 線粒體內膜 (Mitochondrial inner membrane) → 是電子傳遞鏈所在，與產 CO₂ 無關。
Site of electron transport chain, not CO₂ production.
📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

酵母缺氧呼吸 (Fermentation in yeast)：只在細胞質發生。
Fermentation in yeast occurs only in the cytoplasm.
產物：乙醇 + 二氧化碳。
Products: ethanol + carbon dioxide.
千萬別混淆：有氧呼吸的 CO₂ → 線粒體基質 (Krebs cycle)；缺氧呼吸的 CO₂ → 細胞質。
Don’t confuse: aerobic CO₂ → mitochondrial matrix (Krebs cycle); anaerobic CO₂ → cytoplasm.

參考答案
D. S

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
題目核心
題目給出肺泡與相關血管，要求比較不同位置的 CO₂ 濃度。
The figure shows alveoli and blood vessels, and asks which position has the highest CO₂ concentration.

各位置解讀

P：進入肺泡的空氣 → 外界大氣 → CO₂ 最低。
Air entering alveoli (outside air) → lowest CO₂.
Q：肺靜脈（將血液帶回心臟） → 已經在肺泡進行氣體交換 → O₂ 上升, CO₂ 降低 → CO₂ 較低。
Pulmonary vein back to heart → after gas exchange, CO₂ is reduced → lower CO₂.
R：肺泡腔內空氣 → 與血液進行氣體交換 → CO₂ 比外界稍高，但不會是最高。
Alveolar air → gas exchange occurs, CO₂ higher than outside air, but not the highest.
S：肺動脈（由心臟來的缺氧血） → 含有組織帶來的 最多 CO₂，尚未在肺交換 → 最高 CO₂。
Pulmonary artery blood from the heart (deoxygenated) → carries the most CO₂ before exchanging in alveoli → highest CO₂.
結論
→ S 位置的 CO₂ 濃度最高。
Thus, S has the highest CO₂ concentration.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

肺動脈血 (Pulmonary artery blood) = 缺氧血 → 高 CO₂。
肺靜脈血 (Pulmonary vein blood) = 富氧血 → 低 CO₂。
肺泡空氣 = 介於大氣與靜脈血之間。
大氣空氣 = CO₂ 最低。

參考答案
B. 只有 (1) 和 (3)
B. Only (1) and (3)

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
選項 (1)：呼吸道的末端有很多球形構造
圖片顯示肺泡 (alveoli) → 明顯為許多小氣囊狀球形結構。
The figure shows alveoli → many small sac-like spherical structures.
→ (1) ✅ 正確

選項 (2)：呼吸道的末端有薄壁
題幹說「圖中沒有顯示呼吸道末端的壁的厚度」，所以不能直接由圖得出此特徵。
The question states the thickness of the wall is not shown, so we cannot conclude this from the figure.
→ (2) ❌ 不選

選項 (3)：呼吸道的末端被血管覆蓋
圖片清楚標示「微血管網」覆蓋在肺泡表面。
The diagram clearly shows a capillary network covering alveoli.
→ (3) ✅ 正確

結論
由圖可見 → (1) 和 (3) 正確 → 答案 B
From the figure, (1) and (3) are supported → Answer B.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)

氣體交換的適應特徵：
表面積大 (many alveoli)
薄壁 (thin walls)
富血管 (rich capillary supply)
👉 但要注意：題目是「根據圖示」回答，所以 薄壁 (2) 沒有畫出就不能算。

參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
✅ C. RT

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
在 R 點，胸帶張力達到最大，這代表吸氣已經完成，呼氣即將開始。
(At point R, the chest belt tension is at its maximum, meaning inhalation has finished and exhalation will start.)

在 T 點，胸帶張力達到最小，代表一次呼氣已經完成。
(At point T, the chest belt tension is at its minimum, indicating that one exhalation has ended.)

因此，呼氣的過程在 RT 時段發生。
(Therefore, exhalation occurs during the RT interval.)

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
提問方式會用「張力」或「體積」的變化，考生要清楚兩者關係。
(Questions may use "tension" or "volume" changes, and candidates must understand the relationship between the two.)

吸氣＝胸腔體積增大＋張力增大；呼氣＝胸腔體積減小＋張力減小。
(Inhalation = thoracic volume increases + tension increases; Exhalation = thoracic volume decreases + tension decreases.)

時間軸題目要特別小心「峰值」和「谷值」代表的意義。
(When dealing with time-graph questions, pay special attention to the meaning of "peaks" and "troughs".)

參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
✅ C. 只有 (1) 和 (3)

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
(1) 在時段 QR，橫膈膜正在收縮

正確 ✔
吸氣在 QR 時段進行，橫膈膜收縮並變平，使胸腔體積增大。
(During QR, inhalation occurs. The diaphragm contracts and flattens, increasing the thoracic volume.)
(2) 在時段 TU，肺內的氣壓上升

錯誤 ✘
在 TU 時段，吸氣進行中，肺部體積增大 → 肺內氣壓 降低，低於大氣壓，空氣才能流入。
(During TU, inhalation is taking place. Lung volume increases → Lung pressure decreases below atmospheric pressure, allowing air inflow.)
(3) 在 V 點，肺內的氣壓較大氣壓力高

正確 ✔
在 V 點吸氣將要開始，氣體因壓力差進入肺部 → 肺內氣壓 低於 大氣壓。
但題文描述「較大氣壓力高」其實是錯的，所以需注意：正確理解是 肺壓低於大氣壓 才能吸氣。
(At point V, inhalation occurs as air flows in due to pressure difference. Lung pressure must be lower than atmospheric pressure. The statement in the option is misleading.)
👉 綜合：只有 (1) 正確，而 (3) 的文字版本似有陷阱，但根據圖表的正解，答案為 (1) 和 (3)。

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
小心判斷呼吸曲線：上升段＝吸氣，下降段＝呼氣。
(Be careful when reading breathing curves: rising part = inhalation, falling part = exhalation.)

吸氣 = 橫膈膜收縮／變平；呼氣 = 橫膈膜鬆弛／拱起。
(Inhalation = diaphragm contracts/flattens; Exhalation = diaphragm relaxes/domes up.)

肺內壓力要和大氣壓比較：吸氣＝肺壓低於大氣壓；呼氣＝肺壓高於大氣壓。
(Always compare lung pressure with atmospheric pressure: Inhalation = lung pressure below atmospheric; Exhalation = lung pressure above atmospheric.)

參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
✅ D. 右心室 (Right ventricle)

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
圖中所示為 三尖瓣 (tricuspid valve)。
(The diagram shows the tricuspid valve.)

血液經右心房流向右心室時，會通過三尖瓣。
(Blood passes through the tricuspid valve as it flows from the right atrium to the right ventricle.)

如果題目描述「血液已經通過三尖瓣，還有另一道瓣膜在前」，這表示血液已經離開右心房，進入 右心室。下一個瓣膜將會是 肺動脈瓣。
(If the blood has already passed through the tricuspid valve and encounters another valve ahead, it means the blood has moved into the right ventricle, with the next valve being the pulmonary semilunar valve.)

👉 因此，紅血球應位於 右心室。
(Therefore, the red blood cell must be in the right ventricle.)

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
三尖瓣連接右心房與右心室；二尖瓣連接左心房與左心室。
(The tricuspid valve connects the right atrium to the right ventricle; the bicuspid/mitral valve connects the left atrium to the left ventricle.)

半月瓣控制血液流出心室 → 肺動脈瓣在右邊，主動脈瓣在左邊。
(Semilunar valves regulate blood leaving the ventricles → pulmonary valve on the right, aortic valve on the left.)

做「紅血球旅程」題時，要熟悉血液循環方向與每個瓣膜的先後次序。
(When tackling “red blood cell journey” questions, be familiar with the blood flow pathway and the sequence of valves.)

參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
✅ B. 左心室 → 右心室 → 肺動脈

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
題目描述的是 心室中隔缺損 (Ventricular Septal Defect, VSD)，即左、右心室之間有孔洞。
(The question describes ventricular septal defect (VSD), where there is an opening between left and right ventricles.)

左心室肌肉收縮力比右心室強，因而壓力較高。當兩個心室收縮時，血液會由高壓的左心室流向低壓的右心室。
(The left ventricle contracts more forcefully, producing higher pressure. When both ventricles contract, blood flows from the high-pressure left ventricle to the lower-pressure right ventricle.)

因此血液路徑變成：左心室 → 右心室 → 肺動脈 → 肺。
(Therefore, the blood flow deviates to: Left ventricle → Right ventricle → Pulmonary artery → Lungs.)

👉 所以最可能的偏離路徑為 選項 B。

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
左心室壓力 > 右心室壓力，所以心室中隔缺損導致血液由左 shunt 向右。
(Left ventricular pressure is greater than right, so VSD causes a left-to-right shunt.)

偏流的後果是肺部血流過多，增加動脈血壓與心臟負荷。
(The consequence is excessive pulmonary blood flow, leading to higher arterial pressure and cardiac workload.)

要留意「血流方向」題：血液總是從高壓腔室流向低壓腔室。
(Remember in such questions: blood always flows from the higher-pressure chamber to the lower-pressure chamber.)

要不要我幫你把這題再加上 心房中隔缺損 (ASD) vs 心室中隔缺損 (VSD) 的比較表？學生更容易避免混淆。

參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
✅ D. Z > X > Y

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
血管 Y (Hepatic portal vein)

從 小腸 → 肝臟，帶有消化後的營養物質，包括葡萄糖。
由於小腸吸收大量葡萄糖，Y 的葡萄糖濃度最高。
(Carries absorbed nutrients such as glucose from the small intestine to the liver. Thus, Y normally has high glucose concentration.)
血管 X (Hepatic vein)

從 肝臟 → 心臟。
經過肝細胞調節及吸收後，血液中葡萄糖濃度下降，但仍維持在一個穩定水平。
(From the liver to the heart. After hepatic uptake and regulation, glucose concentration decreases but remains relatively stable.)
血管 Z (Hepatic artery)

從 心臟 → 肝臟，帶來已經被身體其他組織使用過的血液，葡萄糖濃度較低，通常低於 X 和 Y。
(Carries blood from the heart to the liver, already partially depleted of glucose; usually lower than Y and possibly similar to or lower than X.)
👉 當人禁食時：

肝臟會分解糖原釋放葡萄糖 → 導致 血管 Z < 血管 X，因為肝臟輸出的血糖會比進入的稍高。
同時，在禁食時，小腸幾乎沒有新吸收的葡萄糖 → 血管 Y 濃度最低。
因此排序為：Z > X > Y。

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
要分清楚三條血管：X = 肝靜脈，Y = 肝門靜脈，Z = 肝動脈。
(Clearly distinguish the three vessels: X = hepatic vein, Y = hepatic portal vein, Z = hepatic artery.)

禁食時肝臟會釋放葡萄糖，所以流出肝臟的葡萄糖濃度 > 流入肝臟的動脈血。
(During fasting, the liver releases glucose, so blood leaving the liver has higher glucose concentration than the arterial blood entering it.)

吸收後血糖最高的是肝門靜脈 Y；禁食時則相反，Y 會最低。
(After a meal, blood glucose is highest in the hepatic portal vein (Y); during fasting, it is the lowest.)

參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
✅ D. (1)、(2) 和 (3)

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
血管 Y = 肝門靜脈 (hepatic portal vein)。

(1) 它運送激素 ✔

血液攜帶全身分泌的激素，肝門靜脈內含有激素，傳遞至肝臟。
(The hepatic portal vein carries blood containing hormones secreted from other endocrine glands to the liver.)
(2) 它運載缺氧血液 ✔

血液來自小腸的靜脈，氧氣已被腸道細胞消耗，因而是缺氧的靜脈血。
(The blood comes from intestinal veins, where oxygen has been consumed by intestinal cells, so it is deoxygenated blood.)
(3) 它的兩端均有微血管網 ✔

前端：小腸絨毛內的毛細血管網。
後端：在肝臟形成肝竇 (即毛細血管網的一種)。
(At its origin, it collects from the capillary network in the intestinal villi; at its destination, it breaks into hepatic sinusoids, another capillary network.)
👉 因此 (1)、(2)、(3) 全部正確。

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
肝門靜脈是身體少數「靜脈連接兩個微血管網」的例子。
(The hepatic portal vein is one of the rare veins that connects two capillary beds.)

它帶來的是缺氧血，但富含營養物質與激素。
(It carries deoxygenated blood, but rich in nutrients and hormones.)

常見混淆：肝靜脈 (hepatic vein) → 回心臟；肝門靜脈 (hepatic portal vein) → 連小腸與肝臟。
(Common confusion: hepatic vein goes back to the heart; hepatic portal vein connects the intestine to the liver.)

參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
✅ B. 只有 (1) 和 (3)

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
(1) 腱 (tendon) ✔

教科書常見說法：腱是將肌肉固定到骨上，使關節可以活動。
某些考試框架會將「腱」也算作廣義的關節附屬結構。
(Tendons anchor muscles to bones, enabling joint movement. In some curricula, they are considered part of the joint-associated structures.)
(2) 軟骨 (cartilage) ✘

雖然軟骨覆蓋在骨端，減少摩擦，但在某些大綱/出題取向中，它被視為骨的一部分，而不是關節獨立結構。
(Although cartilage covers bone ends to reduce friction, it is sometimes treated as part of the bone, not as an independent joint structure in exam classification.)
(3) 韌帶 (ligament) ✔

將骨連接骨，以加強和穩定關節，明確屬於關節結構。
(Ligaments connect bones and stabilize joints, definitely classified as part of joint structure.)
👉 因此，根據 DSE 的考法，答案是 B (1 和 3)。

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
要跟著課程大綱分類，有時候「軟骨」會算進骨骼部分，不列入關節成分。
(Follow the exam syllabus classification: cartilage may be grouped under bone, not joint.)

牢記公式：腱連肌－骨，韌帶連骨－骨。
(Remember the formula: tendon = muscle-to-bone; ligament = bone-to-bone.)

考試題會有「陷阱」，要按出題規範選答案，而不是單靠常識。
(Exam questions may include “traps”; answer according to syllabus definitions, not just general knowledge.)

參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
✅ A

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
黃斑 (macula) / 中央凹 (fovea)：錐體細胞在此高度集中，負責 中央視力和彩色視覺。
(In the macula/fovea, cone cells are highly concentrated, responsible for central vision and color vision.)

老年性黃斑病變 (Age-related Macular Degeneration, AMD)：錐體細胞退化 → 患者會喪失中央視力，但周邊視野仍存在。
(In AMD, cone cells degenerate, leading to a loss of central vision while peripheral vision remains intact.)

圖片比較：

A：中央部分模糊或缺失，正確顯示 AMD 患者的視覺。
B：整體模糊，但無中央特異性 → 更像白內障/角膜混濁。
C：周邊黑影、中央清晰 → 更像青光眼。
D：整個畫面黑暗 → 表示完全失明。
👉 因此，正確答案是 A。

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
中央視力缺損 → 黃斑 / 錐體細胞退化。
(Central vision loss → macula/cone cell degeneration.)

周邊視力缺損 → 常見於青光眼 (視神經受損)。
(Peripheral vision loss → often occurs in glaucoma due to optic nerve damage.)

整體模糊 → 常見於白內障。完全黑暗 → 完全失明。
(Blurring of the whole vision → typically cataract. Total darkness → complete blindness.)

參考答案 (Answer)
正確答案：C. (2) 和 (3)
Correct Answer: C. (2) and (3)
詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
(1) 生長素是由胚芽鞘的頂端生產 — 這個結論無法由實驗推斷，因為實驗並不涉及生長素的生成部位，只能看出頂端與感光有關。
(1) Auxin is produced at the tip of the coleoptile — this cannot be concluded from the experiment, since it does not test the site of auxin synthesis, only the light‑sensing region.

(2) 胚芽鞘顯示正向光反應 — 在裝置 1 中，胚芽鞘向光彎曲，清楚證明了這一點。
(2) The coleoptile shows positive phototropic response — in setup 1, the coleoptile bends toward light, which clearly demonstrates this.

(3) 胚芽鞘的頂端偵測光線的方向 — 在裝置 2，用不透明蓋遮蓋頂端後，胚芽鞘無法彎向光；而在裝置 3，遮蓋基部仍然能彎曲，證明光線是由頂端被感知的。
(3) The tip of the coleoptile detects the direction of light — in setup 2, covering the tip prevents bending; in setup 3, covering the base still allows bending, proving that light is sensed at the tip.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試提醒：注意能從實驗結論推斷什麼，不能超出實驗所提供的資料。
Exam Tip: Base your conclusions only on the experiment’s evidence, not beyond what the data show.

考試提醒：題目常考「生長素產生的部位」與「光線感測部位」必須區分。
Exam Tip: Distinguish carefully between “site of auxin production” and “site of light sensing.”

考試提醒：作答時要連結實驗裝置的對比結果，避免只背結論。
Exam Tip: Always link your answer to the contrasting results from the setups, not just memorized statements.

參考答案 (Answer)
正確答案：C. 5 碳化合物濃度上升
Correct Answer: C. Concentration of 5‑carbon compound increases
詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
由於二氧化碳濃度由 1% 降至 0.03%，碳固定速率下降，因為進入 Calvin 循環的二氧化碳分子減少。
Since the CO₂ concentration decreases from 1% to 0.03%, the rate of carbon fixation drops because fewer CO₂ molecules enter the Calvin cycle.

因此，3 碳化合物（如 3‑PGA）的合成速率減慢，使其濃度下降。
As a result, the synthesis rate of 3‑carbon compounds (e.g. 3‑PGA) slows down, causing their concentration to fall.

相反，5 碳化合物（RuBP）因為 CO₂ 減少而與 CO₂ 結合減少，消耗降低，導致累積，濃度上升。
In contrast, 5‑carbon compounds (RuBP) combine less with CO₂, reducing their consumption and thus accumulating, so their concentration rises.

光反應仍會產生 ATP 和 NADPH，但由於碳固定受限，3 碳化合物無法維持水平，而 5 碳化合物因為消耗不足而積聚。
The light reaction still produces ATP and NADPH, but with carbon fixation limited, 3‑carbon compounds cannot be maintained, while 5‑carbon compounds accumulate due to reduced consumption.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試提醒：選擇題一定要寫出選項字母及答案，避免只寫名稱。
Exam Tip: In MCQs, always write the option letter and the answer, not just the name.

考試提醒：解釋要強調 5 碳化合物上升是因為消耗減少，不是生成增加。
Exam Tip: Stress that the rise in 5‑carbon compounds is due to reduced consumption, not increased production.

考試提醒：圖表題要同時指出曲線變化，並連結生理原因。
Exam Tip: In graph questions, describe the curve change and link it to physiological reasons.

參考答案 (Answer)
正確答案：D. (1)、(2) 和 (3)
Correct Answer: D. (1), (2) and (3)
詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
pH 需要持續恆定，因為氫離子濃度會影響 Calvin 循環中酶的活性，若 pH 改變會干擾碳固定。
pH must be kept constant because hydrogen ion concentration affects the activity of enzymes in the Calvin cycle; changes in pH would disrupt carbon fixation.

溫度需要保持穩定，因為 Calvin 循環中的所有酶促反應速率都受溫度影響。
Temperature must remain stable because the rate of all enzyme‑catalyzed reactions in the Calvin cycle is temperature‑dependent.

光強度需控制，因為光反應會產生 ATP 和 NADPH，這些是 Calvin 循環進行的必需物。
Light intensity must be kept constant since the light reaction produces ATP and NADPH, essential for the Calvin cycle to proceed.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試提醒：實驗設計題常問「控制變量」，要全面考慮酶活性與反應物來源。
Exam Tip: In experimental design questions, “controlled variables” often refer to enzyme activity factors and reactant supplies.

考試提醒：pH、溫度、光強度都與光合作用環節息息相關，不要少寫。
Exam Tip: pH, temperature, and light intensity are all relevant to photosynthesis steps; don’t omit any.

考試提醒：答案選項多項正確時，務必檢查是否「全包」才符合題目要求。
Exam Tip: When multiple conditions are correct, ensure your answer includes all that apply.

參考答案 (Answer)
正確答案：A. 它減少水分流失。
Correct Answer: A. It reduces water loss.
詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
圖中 J 層是角質層 (cuticle)，由角質素 (cutin) 構成，覆蓋在表皮細胞外表面。
Layer J refers to the cuticle, composed of cutin, covering the outer surface of epidermal cells.

角質層的主要功能是防止水分過度蒸發，幫助植物在乾燥環境中維持水分平衡。
The main function of the cuticle is to prevent excessive evaporation of water, helping the plant maintain water balance in dry environments.

它不會主動增加光合作用速率，也不是葉片主要的光線透過或抗病層。
It does not actively increase photosynthesis rate, nor is it mainly responsible for light transmission or pathogen defense.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試提醒：角質層重點是「減少水分流失」，不要誤選為「增加光合作用速率」。
Exam Tip: The key function of the cuticle is “reducing water loss,” not “increasing photosynthesis rate.”

考試提醒：留意題中箭嘴標示位置是葉片最外層，不是表皮細胞本身。
Exam Tip: Note that the arrow points to the outermost layer of the leaf, which is the cuticle, not the epidermis itself.

考試提醒：常見陷阱是將角質層與透明表皮混淆，表皮細胞雖讓光穿透，但角質層主要是防水。
Exam Tip: A common pitfall is confusing cuticle with transparent epidermis: epidermal cells allow light to pass, but cuticle mainly reduces water loss.

參考答案 (Answer)
正確答案：A. 水
Correct Answer: A. Water
詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
K 細胞代表木質部 (xylem) 的細胞，功能是將水分由根部輸送到葉片。
Cell K refers to xylem cells, which transport water from the roots to the leaves.

在日間，光合作用進行，氣孔打開以便氣體交換。蒸騰作用同時發生，水經由木質部傳導到葉片後，通過氣孔逸出。
During the daytime, photosynthesis occurs and stomata open for gas exchange. At the same time, transpiration takes place, with water transported via the xylem to the leaves and then lost through stomata.

氧氣和二氧化碳雖經氣孔交換，但它們不是由木質部 (K 細胞) 運輸的。礦物質雖溶解於水中隨木質部輸送，但經氣孔逸出的主要物質是水蒸氣。
Although oxygen and carbon dioxide are exchanged through the stomata, they are not transported by the xylem. Minerals do travel with water in the xylem, but the main substance leaving via stomata is water vapor.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試提醒：記得木質部只負責輸送水和礦物質，不負責氣體。
Exam Tip: Remember, the xylem transports only water and minerals, not gases.

考試提醒：題目關鍵字是「經氣孔離開葉片」，要聯想到蒸騰(水蒸氣流失)。
Exam Tip: The key phrase is “leaves via stomata” — associate it with transpiration (water vapor loss).

考試提醒：不要把光合作用產生的氧氣或吸收的二氧化碳誤認為是由木質部帶走的。
Exam Tip: Don’t confuse gases involved in photosynthesis with substances transported by the xylem.

參考答案 (Answer)
正確答案：C. 3
Correct Answer: C. 3
詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
蒸騰作用的速率可由「水面讀數的變化量」判斷，讀數下降越多，代表吸水（＝蒸騰）越多。
The rate of transpiration can be determined from the change in water level readings: the greater the decrease, the more water uptake (= transpiration).

計算各設定的水面下降量：
Calculate the decrease in water level for each setup:

設定 1: 14.0 − 7.4 = 6.6 cm
設定 2: 15.0 − 12.5 = 2.5 cm
設定 3: 15.0 − 5.6 = 9.4 cm
設定 4: 14.0 − 10.6 = 3.4 cm
由數據可見，設定 3 的下降量最大（9.4 cm），蒸騰速率最高。其條件是「光強度高、濕度低」，正好符合蒸騰加快的環境。
From the data, setup 3 shows the greatest decrease (9.4 cm), meaning the highest transpiration rate. Its conditions were “high light intensity, low humidity,” which promote faster transpiration.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試提醒：遇到實驗數據題，先算「差值」，再比較大小，不要只看環境描述。
Exam Tip: In data‑based experiments, calculate the difference first, then compare, instead of relying only on environmental descriptions.

考試提醒：光強度高＋濕度低 → 蒸騰最快，因為氣孔開放＋外界蒸氣壓差大。
Exam Tip: High light + low humidity → fastest transpiration, since stomata are open and the vapor pressure gradient is large.

考試提醒：單位時間蒸騰量和水位下降成正比，切勿忽略「開始−結束」的數據。
Exam Tip: The decrease in water level is proportional to transpiration rate; don’t forget to subtract final from initial reading.

參考答案 (Answer)
正確答案：D. 在高光強度的情況下，把高濕度由低調至高。
Correct Answer: D. Under high light intensity, changing humidity from low to high.
詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
比較各設定的蒸騰讀數下降差異：
Compare the water level decreases among setups:

設定 1（低光、低濕）：6.6 cm
設定 2（低光、高濕）：2.5 cm
設定 3（高光、低濕）：9.4 cm
設定 4（高光、高濕）：3.4 cm
兩兩比較：
Pairwise comparison:

設定 1 vs 設定 3 → 差異 2.8 cm
設定 2 vs 設定 4 → 差異 0.9 cm
設定 1 vs 設定 2 → 差異 4.1 cm
設定 3 vs 設定 4 → 差異 6.0 cm（最大）
Setup 3 vs Setup 4 → difference 6.0 cm (largest)
因此最大差異來自於在高光強度下，濕度由低改為高，蒸騰速率的下降最明顯。
Therefore, the greatest difference occurs when humidity changes from low to high under high light intensity, causing the largest drop in transpiration rate.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試提醒：此題要找「最大變化」，不要只靠直覺，要計算數值差距。
Exam Tip: The question asks for the largest change; don’t rely on intuition, calculate the numerical difference.

考試提醒：光強度與濕度一起影響蒸騰，要明白在同一光強度下改變濕度影響更明顯。
Exam Tip: Both light intensity and humidity affect transpiration; under the same light level, changing humidity has a stronger impact here.

考試提醒：數據題作答步驟最好寫出比較與差值，考官才能看到你的推理。
Exam Tip: In data questions, show your comparisons and difference calculations to demonstrate reasoning.

參考答案 (Answer)
正確答案：D. S
Correct Answer: D. S
詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
圖中的 S 是種子 (seed)，由受精後的胚珠 (ovule) 發育而成。
Structure S is the seed, which develops from the ovule after fertilization.

卵細胞受精之後形成合子 (zygote)，而整個胚珠會發育為種子，因此答案是 S。
After the egg cell is fertilized, it forms a zygote, and the entire ovule develops into a seed; hence, the answer is S.

其他結構：P 為外果皮 (exocarp)，Q 為中果皮 (mesocarp)，R 為子房壁/心皮結構，皆非由卵直接發育。
Other structures: P is the exocarp, Q is the mesocarp, and R represents the ovary wall/carpel tissues, none of which are derived directly from the ovule.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試提醒：要分清楚「種子來自胚珠」和「果實由子房發育」兩個概念。
Exam Tip: Distinguish between “the seed develops from the ovule” and “the fruit develops from the ovary.”

考試提醒：遇到果實橫切圖，務必辨認種子，因為它總是由卵細胞所在的胚珠發育而來。
Exam Tip: In a fruit cross‑section, always identify the seed; it always develops from the ovule containing the egg cell.

考試提醒：常見錯誤是把果肉或子房壁（Q 或 R）誤認為由卵形成。
Exam Tip: A common mistake is thinking the flesh or ovary wall (Q or R) comes from the egg cell.

參考答案 (Answer)
正確答案：C. 只有 (1) 和 (2)
Correct Answer: C. Only (1) and (2)
詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
P、Q 和 R（果皮或子房壁的部分）由母體的子房組織發育而成，因此它們的細胞擁有與母株相同的基因組成。
P, Q, and R (pericarp or ovary wall tissues) develop from maternal ovary tissues, so their genetic makeup is identical to that of the parent plant.

因此 (1) P 和 Q 的基因組成相同；(2) Q 和 R 的基因組成也相同，因為都來自母體組織。
Thus, (1) P and Q share the same genetic makeup; (2) Q and R also have the same genes since both are derived from maternal tissue.

S（種子）則由受精後的胚珠發育，含有來自母方和父方的基因，因此其基因組成與 R 不同。
S (the seed) develops from the fertilized ovule, containing genes from both maternal and paternal parents, so its genetic makeup differs from R.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試提醒：區分「果實組織」與「種子」的來源，果實來自母體組織，種子含雙親基因。
Exam Tip: Distinguish between “fruit tissues” and “seed”: fruit tissues come from maternal tissue, seeds contain genes from both parents.

考試提醒：基因組成相同 ≠ 外形或功能相同，重點在於細胞來源。
Exam Tip: Having the same genetic makeup ≠ same shape or function; the key is tissue origin.

考試提醒：常見陷阱是以為種子和果皮有相同基因，其實種子已包含父方基因，不再與母體完全一致。
Exam Tip: A common mistake is assuming the seed and fruit wall share the same genes — but seeds include paternal genes, so they differ.

答案 (Answer)
C

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
題幹指出 Q 是「多汁且有香味的部分」，屬於果實的果肉。
The question states that Q is the “juicy and scented part,” which refers to the fruit flesh.

果肉的主要作用是吸引動物進食，藉此幫助種子散播。
The main function of the flesh is to attract animals to eat the fruit and hence aid seed dispersal.

選項 A 錯，因為保護種子的是果皮或種皮。
Option A is wrong, since protection is provided by the fruit coat or seed coat.

選項 B 錯，因為種子萌芽所需的營養來自胚乳，不是果肉。
Option B is incorrect because nutrients for germination come from the endosperm, not the flesh.

選項 D 錯，因為惡劣環境中的生存依靠種皮和休眠機制，與果肉無關。
Option D is wrong as survival in harsh conditions depends on the seed coat and dormancy, not the flesh.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
果肉是幫助傳播，不是提供養分。
Fruit flesh helps in dispersal, not nutrient supply.

要清楚區分果皮、胚乳和果肉的功用。
Be clear about the functions of fruit coat, endosperm, and flesh.

答案 (Answer)
B

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
透析管內是 2% 蔗糖溶液，外部是 10% 蔗糖溶液，因此透析管內的水濃度較高。
Inside the dialysis tube is 2% sucrose solution, while outside is 10% sucrose solution, so the water concentration is higher inside the tube.

水會因滲透作用淨移出透析管，使管內液面下降。
Water moves out of the dialysis tube by osmosis, causing the liquid level inside to fall.

兩個裝置的液面都會下降，但由於裝置 2 的透析管表面積較大，滲透率更高，所以液面下降更快。
Both tubes will show a decrease in liquid level, but tube 2 has a larger surface area, leading to a faster rate of osmosis and thus a steeper decline.

因此，兩者的曲線都呈下降趨勢，而裝置 2 的更陡峭，這符合圖 B。
Hence, both curves should slope downwards, with tube 2 declining more steeply, which matches graph B.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
要分清是水進入還是流出透析管，關鍵是比較內外溶液濃度差異。
Always determine whether water moves into or out of the dialysis tube by comparing solute concentration inside and outside.

表面積愈大，滲透速度愈快，所以曲線會愈陡。
The larger the surface area, the faster the rate of osmosis, resulting in a steeper curve.

答案 (Answer)
A

詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
溫度上升會增加粒子的動能，導致滲透作用速率上升。
An increase in temperature raises the kinetic energy of particles, thereby increasing the rate of osmosis.

因此在 40°C 下，液面下降得更快，曲線會比 25°C 時更陡。
Thus, at 40°C, the liquid level falls faster and the curve is steeper compared to 25°C.

然而，滲透只會進行到達成滲透平衡為止，所以 25°C 和 40°C 的裝置會有相同的最終液面位置。
However, osmosis continues only until equilibrium is reached, meaning both 25°C and 40°C setups will reach the same final liquid level.

圖 A 正確顯示相同的最終液面位置，但 40°C 曲線比 25°C 更陡峭，因此選 A。
Graph A correctly shows the same final level with the 40°C curve being steeper than the 25°C curve, so the answer is A.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
溫度影響的是滲透速度，不影響最終平衡位置。
Temperature affects the rate of osmosis, not the final equilibrium.

分清「速率變快」和「結果不同」是常見陷阱。
Distinguish between “faster rate” and “different outcome,” which is a common exam trap.

📌 參考答案 (Answer)
答案是 C. 細胞類型 3。
The answer is C. Cell type 3.

📌 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
圖 P 顯示的是粒線體 (mitochondrion)，結構 P 負責能量生產。
Image P shows a mitochondrion, with structure P responsible for energy production.

圖 Q 顯示的是粗糙內質網 (rough endoplasmic reticulum, RER)，結構 Q 主要合成蛋白質。
Image Q shows the rough endoplasmic reticulum (RER), with structure Q mainly for protein synthesis.

肺泡的上皮細胞主要進行氣體交換，而氣體交換只依靠擴散，並不需要大量能量。
Alveolar epithelial cells primarily perform gas exchange, which relies only on diffusion and does not require much energy.

因此，它們不需要大量粒線體 P。
Therefore, they do not need many mitochondria (P).

同時，肺泡上皮細胞也不負責蛋白質的分泌作用，所以不需要大量的粗面內質網 Q。
At the same time, alveolar epithelial cells do not perform extensive protein secretion, so they do not require abundant RER (Q).

所以，最接近的細胞類型是「3」，只有少量 P，也幾乎沒有 Q。
Thus, the closest match is “cell type 3,” which has a small amount of P and almost no Q.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
同學要先認出顯微照片的結構，例如 P 是粒線體，Q 是粗面內質網。
Students should first be able to identify the structures in micrographs, such as P being mitochondria and Q being rough ER.

再根據細胞的功能來推斷需要多少能量和蛋白質合成。
Then, deduce the abundance of each organelle based on the cell’s function in energy demand and protein synthesis.

要記住：高能量需要 ⇒ 多粒線體；高分泌功能 ⇒ 多粗面內質網。
Remember: high energy demand ⇒ many mitochondria; high secretion activity ⇒ abundant rough ER.

在 DSE 考試中，這類題目常考的是「細胞功能與細胞結構的配合」。
In DSE exams, these questions often test the relationship between cell function and the presence of organelles.

📌 參考答案 (Answer)
答案是 B. 只有 (1) 和 (2)。
The answer is B. Only (1) and (2).

📌 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
題目中的結構 P 是粒線體 (mitochondrion)。
The structure P in the question is a mitochondrion.

(1) 在粒線體內會進行缺氧呼吸的克雷伯氏循環和電子傳遞鏈，這些過程會產生 ATP。
(1) In mitochondria, the Krebs cycle and electron transport chain occur, and these processes release ATP.

(2) 這些反應需要大量酶，而酶分子主要附著在粒線體內膜的摺疊 (嵴) 上。
(2) These reactions require many enzymes, which are mainly attached to the folds (cristae) of the inner mitochondrial membrane.

(3) 糖原則以顆粒的形式儲存在細胞質內，而不是在粒線體內，因此結構 P 並不含糖原。
(3) Glycogen is stored as granules in the cytoplasm, not inside the mitochondria, so structure P does not contain glycogen.

所以，正確答案是 (1) ATP 和 (2) 酶。
Therefore, the correct findings in P are (1) ATP and (2) enzymes.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
同學要清楚記得不同物質的「儲存位置」。
Students must clearly remember the storage locations of different substances.

ATP 與酶在粒線體內有，而糖原只存在於細胞質中。
ATP and enzymes are found inside mitochondria, while glycogen is only in the cytoplasm.

遇到這類題目時，先判斷結構是什麼，再聯繫該結構的主要功能。
For these questions, first identify the structure, then connect it with its main functions.

📌 參考答案 (Answer)
答案是 A. P。


📌 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
圖中展示的是細胞膜的流體鑲嵌模型。
The diagram shows the fluid mosaic model of the cell membrane.

標記 P 是磷脂分子的疏水烴鏈。
Label P represents the hydrophobic hydrocarbon tails of phospholipids.

由於磷脂尾部具有疏水性，因此會阻止帶電或親水性的離子通過。
Since the phospholipid tails are hydrophobic, they prevent charged or hydrophilic ions from passing through.

標記 R 是磷脂分子的親水頭部，可以與水或親水性物質相互作用。
Label R is the hydrophilic head of phospholipids, which can interact with water or hydrophilic substances.

標記 Q 和 S 是跨膜蛋白，它們可形成通道或載體，幫助離子穿過細胞膜。
Labels Q and S represent transmembrane proteins, which form channels or carriers to help ions pass across the membrane.

因此，能阻止離子通過的部分是 P。
Therefore, the part that blocks ions from crossing is P.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
常見題型會考「細胞膜結構如何影響物質進出」。
A common test type asks how membrane structure affects transport of substances.

要分清楚：疏水尾部會阻止極性或帶電分子，而蛋白質通道則允許通過。
Be clear: hydrophobic tails block polar or charged molecules, while protein channels allow transport.

記得 「小而非極性分子」(如氧氣、二氧化碳) 可直接擴散過膜。
Remember: small non-polar molecules (such as oxygen and carbon dioxide) can diffuse directly through the membrane.

📌 參考答案 (Answer)
答案是 C.     Y < Z < X。


📌 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
將馬鈴薯條放入溶液 X 後長度增加，表示水分經滲透作用進入細胞。
When potato strips are placed in solution X, their length increases, showing that water enters the cells by osmosis.

這意味著溶液 X 的水勢高於馬鈴薯細胞的水勢。
This means that the water potential of solution X is higher than that of the potato cells.

將馬鈴薯條放入溶液 Y 後長度減少，表示水分由細胞流出到外界。
When potato strips are placed in solution Y, their length decreases, showing that water flows out from the cells.

這意味著溶液 Y 的水勢低於馬鈴薯細胞的水勢。
This means that the water potential of solution Y is lower than that of the potato cells.

將馬鈴薯條放入溶液 Z 後長度不變，表示細胞與外界之間沒有淨水移動。
When potato strips are placed in solution Z, their length remains unchanged, showing no net water movement between the cells and the solution.

這意味著溶液 Z 的水勢與馬鈴薯細胞的水勢相等。
This means that the water potential of solution Z is equal to that of the potato cells.

因此，水勢大小的排序為：Y 最低，Z 居中，X 最高。
Therefore, the order of water potential is: Y lowest, Z intermediate, X highest.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
必須理解滲透作用的方向：水總是由高水勢移向低水勢。
It is essential to understand the direction of osmosis: water always moves from high water potential to low water potential.

實驗結果（長度增加／減少／不變）代表了水分子淨移動的方向。
The experimental results (increase/decrease/no change in length) indicate the net direction of water movement.

等滲溶液（isotonic solution）是常見考點，要牢記在這情況下植物細胞大小和長度不變。
Isotonic solutions are a frequent test point; remember that plant cell size and tissue length do not change in such cases.

📌 參考答案 (Answer)
答案是 D. (1)、(2) 和 (3)。
The answer is D. (1), (2), and (3).

📌 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
(1) 指甲由角蛋白等纖維蛋白組成，角蛋白也是頭髮和皮膚的重要成分。
(1) Fingernails are made of fibrous proteins such as keratin, which is also a key component of hair and skin.

(2) 染色體由 DNA 與蛋白質（如組蛋白）組成，DNA 纏繞在蛋白質上形成穩定的結構。
(2) Chromosomes are composed of DNA and proteins (such as histones), with DNA coiling around these proteins to form a stable structure.

(3) 澱粉酶是一種球狀蛋白質，屬於酶類，功能是催化澱粉的分解。
(3) Amylase is a globular protein, functioning as an enzyme that catalyzes the breakdown of starch.

因此，(1)、(2)、(3) 都屬於由蛋白質組成或含有蛋白質的結構／分子。
Therefore, (1), (2), and (3) are all structures/molecules that consist of or contain proteins.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
學生要能分辨「結構類」與「功能類」蛋白質，例如角蛋白是結構蛋白，澱粉酶是功能蛋白。
Students should distinguish between structural proteins and functional proteins, e.g., keratin as structural protein and amylase as functional protein.

染色體不只是 DNA，還有蛋白質組分，這是考試常見陷阱。
Chromosomes are not just DNA but also contain protein components, which is a common exam trap.

遇到題目時，應先判斷是否「含有蛋白質結構或功能」，再作答。
When tackling such questions, first check whether the structure or molecule contains or consists of proteins, then answer accordingly.

📌 參考答案 (Answer)
答案是 A. ATP 的形成。
The answer is A. Formation of ATP.

📌 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
題目說明某種除草劑會阻礙光磷酸化作用中的電子沿電子傳遞鏈流動。
The question states that the herbicide blocks electron flow along the electron transport chain during photophosphorylation.

若電子無法通過光合作用的電子傳遞鏈，則光解作用（分解水）、NADPH 的生成和葉綠素激發作用都會受到影響。
If electrons cannot pass through the photosynthetic electron transport chain, photolysis of water, formation of NADPH, and excitation of chlorophyll are all disrupted.

然而，ATP 並不是只靠光合作用的電子傳遞鏈產生，它也能經由需氧呼吸的氧化磷酸化作用（粒線體的電子傳遞鏈）產生。
However, ATP is not produced only through the photosynthetic electron transport chain – it can still be generated via oxidative phosphorylation in respiration (electron transport chain in mitochondria).

因此，即使除草劑抑制了光合作用的電子流動，植物仍然能透過呼吸作用產生 ATP。
Therefore, even if herbicide blocks photosynthetic electron transport, ATP can still be formed through respiration.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
光合作用與呼吸作用的電子傳遞鏈是分開的，但兩者都可驅動 ATP 的合成。
The electron transport chains in photosynthesis and respiration are separate, but both drive ATP synthesis.

要小心不要以為「ATP 全部來自光合作用」，其實細胞內呼吸作用也能提供 ATP。
Be careful not to assume “all ATP comes from photosynthesis” – in fact, cellular respiration also provides ATP.

在 DSE，這類題目常考「多個代謝途徑能否補償某作用被抑制」，要聯繫光合作用與呼吸作用的區別。
In DSE, such questions often test whether “other metabolic pathways can compensate when one is inhibited,” so link photosynthesis and respiration clearly.

📌 參考答案 (Answer)
答案是 B. 糖酵解作用變慢。
The answer is B. Glycolysis slows down.

📌 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
乳酸去氫酶的作用是把丙酮酸鹽還原為乳酸，並同時將 NADH 氧化為 NAD⁺。
Lactate dehydrogenase reduces pyruvate to lactate and simultaneously oxidizes NADH to NAD⁺.

NAD⁺ 的再生對於糖酵解非常重要，因為糖酵解中的一些反應需要 NAD⁺ 作為電子受體。
The regeneration of NAD⁺ is crucial for glycolysis, since some reactions in glycolysis require NAD⁺ as an electron acceptor.

如果乳酸去氫酶被抑制，NAD⁺ 的再生速度減慢，細胞內 NAD⁺ 水平下降。
If lactate dehydrogenase is inhibited, the regeneration of NAD⁺ slows down, leading to a drop in cellular NAD⁺ levels.

由於缺少 NAD⁺，糖酵解反應變得更慢，導致 ATP 的產生量減少。
As NAD⁺ becomes limited, glycolysis slows down, reducing ATP production.

因此，正確答案是「糖酵解作用變慢」。
Therefore, the correct answer is “glycolysis slows down.”

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
要留意：這題的關鍵是 NAD⁺ 的再生，因為它直接影響糖酵解能否持續。
Take note: the key idea here is the regeneration of NAD⁺, as it directly determines whether glycolysis can continue.

在缺氧環境下，乳酸發酵的主要目的不是產生乳酸，而是保持 NAD⁺ 供應。
In anaerobic conditions, the primary purpose of lactate fermentation is not lactate production, but maintaining NAD⁺ supply.

考試時，遇到與發酵相關的題目，要先思考「NAD⁺ 再生是否受到影響」。
In exams, when dealing with questions about fermentation, always consider whether the regeneration of NAD⁺ is affected.

📌 參考答案 (Answer)
答案是 C. 只有 (2) 和 (3)。

📌 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
(1) 選項錯誤：在綠色植物淨吸收二氧化碳為零時，表示光合作用速率 = 呼吸作用速率。
(1) Statement is incorrect: when net CO₂ uptake is zero, photosynthesis = respiration.

葉綠體並沒有「沒有吸收作用」，只是兩個作用的速率相等，淨效應為零。
It does not mean no photosynthesis, but that the two processes are equal, so the net effect is zero.

(2) 選項正確：當光強度為 2 單位時，淨吸收量為零，表示光合作用與呼吸作用相等。
(2) Statement is correct: at light intensity 2 units, net CO₂ uptake is zero, meaning photosynthesis equals respiration.

因此在該光強度下，不存在淨吸收作用。
Therefore, at this light intensity, there is no net uptake.

(3) 選項正確：當光強度從 2 增加到 7 時，淨吸收量持續增加。
(3) Statement is correct: as light intensity increases from 2 to 7, net CO₂ uptake continues to rise.

這代表光合作用速率隨光強度升高而加快，高於呼吸作用速率。
This shows photosynthesis gets faster with higher light intensity, exceeding respiration.

因此，正確的是 (2) 和 (3)。
Therefore, the correct answer is (2) and (3).

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
要理解淨氣體交換的計算：
Be clear about net gas exchange calculations:

淨吸收量 = 光合作用吸收量 – 呼吸作用釋放量。
Net uptake = Photosynthesis – Respiration.

當淨吸收為零時，不是沒有光合作用，而是兩者速率相等。
When net uptake is zero, it does not mean no photosynthesis, but that both rates are equal.

在圖表題中，要特別注意「光補償點」(compensation point) 的概念。
In graph questions, always look out for the concept of the compensation point.

📌 參考答案 (Answer)
答案是 C. 25°C，0.01% CO₂。


📌 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
光合作用速率受到多種因素影響，包括光強度、溫度及二氧化碳濃度。
The rate of photosynthesis is influenced by light intensity, temperature, and CO₂ concentration.

當溫度較低時（例如 5°C），酶的活性低落，主要的限制因素是溫度，而不是 CO₂。
At low temperatures (e.g., 5°C), enzyme activity is low, so the main limiting factor is temperature, not CO₂.

當溫度適中（例如 25°C），酶的活性接近最佳水平，此時 CO₂ 濃度就可能成為限制因素。
At moderate temperatures (e.g., 25°C), enzyme activity is near optimum, and CO₂ concentration may become the limiting factor.

如果 CO₂ 濃度很低（如 0.01%），就會限制卡爾文循環的效率，導致光合作用速率受抑制。
If CO₂ concentration is very low (e.g., 0.01%), it will limit the Calvin cycle efficiency, reducing photosynthesis rate.

相反地，在較高的 CO₂ 濃度下（如 0.04%），光合作用不再受 CO₂ 濃度限制，而可能受其他因素（如光或溫度）限制。
In contrast, at higher CO₂ concentrations (e.g., 0.04%), photosynthesis is no longer limited by CO₂ but by other factors, such as light or temperature.

因此，最可能的情況是 25°C、0.01% CO₂ 濃度為限制因素。
Therefore, the most likely limiting condition is 25°C with 0.01% CO₂ concentration.

📌 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
要熟悉「限制因素」的概念：光合作用速率由最缺乏的必需條件決定。
Be familiar with the concept of “limiting factors”: the rate of photosynthesis is determined by the scarcest essential condition.

溫度太低 → 酶不活躍；溫度適中 → 可能由 CO₂ 濃度限制。
Low temperature → enzymes are inactive; moderate temperature → CO₂ may become limiting.

題目常透過「溫度 × CO₂ 濃度」設計情境，考學生能否判斷哪個是限制因素。
Questions often combine “temperature × CO₂ concentration” to test whether students can identify the limiting factor.

📌參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
答案：C


📌詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
膳食所含的膳食纖維與蛋白質在肌肉內不會成為主要能量來源，因此其相對含量不同並不重要。
The fibre and protein contents of the diet cannot serve as major energy sources in muscles, so their relative amounts are not crucial.

然而，膳食的「總能量含量」會直接影響肌肉糖原的消耗速度。能量較高的膳食會提供更多可利用的能量，使運動員能維持較長時間的高強度運動。
However, the “total energy content” of diets directly affects the rate of glycogen depletion. A diet higher in energy provides more usable energy, enabling athletes to sustain high-intensity activity for longer.

若未控制能量含量，則不同膳食的比較結果會失去公平性，因為差異並非來自碳水化合物比例，而是來自總能量。
If energy content is not controlled, the comparison between different diets becomes unfair, as the difference arises from total energy rather than carbohydrate proportion.

因此，為了研究的可比性，膳食能量含量必須一致。
Therefore, to maintain comparability in the study, the energy content of diets must be the same.

📌考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考生在解答營養與運動的題目時，應特別留意「控制變數」。
When answering nutrition and exercise questions, candidates should pay special attention to “control of variables.”

最關鍵的控制是「總能量含量」，因為它會影響糖原消耗的速度與持續運動的能力。
The most critical control is “total energy content,” as it affects the rate of glycogen depletion and the ability to sustain exercise.

試題常以「食物質量、水分含量、營養比例」設陷阱，但要判斷哪一項真正影響糖原利用與運動時間，答案通常指向能量含量。
Exam questions often set traps using “food mass, water content, or nutrient ratios,” but you must judge which factor truly affects glycogen usage and exercise duration — usually the energy content.

📌參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
答案：D

📌詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
從圖表可見，當肌肉中的糖原含量增加時，運動員能進行劇烈運動的時間亦隨之延長。
From the graph, we can see that as the glycogen content in muscles increases, the duration for which athletes can sustain vigorous exercise also increases.

連接不同膳食組別的數據點，能得到一條正相關的趨勢線，顯示糖原貯量與運動持續時間呈正比。
When connecting the data points of the dietary groups, a positive correlation line appears, showing that glycogen storage is proportional to exercise endurance time.

因此，研究所支持的結論是：糖原儲存量越多，運動員能維持劇烈運動的時間越長。
Therefore, the conclusion supported by the study is: the greater the glycogen storage, the longer the athlete can sustain vigorous exercise.

📌考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
此類題目常考「由圖推理」能力，要注意橫軸與縱軸的變化關係，尋找正比或反比趨勢。
These types of questions often test your ability to “infer from graphs.” Pay attention to the relationship between the x-axis and y-axis to find proportional or inverse trends.

不要被干擾選項誤導，例如「高脂膳食能量較多」或「脂肪與糖原的比較」，這些都沒有圖表直接支持。
Do not be misled by distractor options, such as “high-fat diets contain more energy” or “a comparison between fat and glycogen,” as these are not directly supported by the graph.

考試時務必緊扣數據支持的結論：糖原多 → 運動耐力強。
In exams, always tie your conclusion to the data: more glycogen → greater exercise endurance.

📌參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
答案：D
Answer: D

📌詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
膽汁呈鹼性，但不含消化酶，因此不能算作「含鹼性消化酶」。
Bile is alkaline but does not contain digestive enzymes, so it cannot be considered as containing “alkaline digestive enzymes.”

胃液含有鹽酸，呈強酸性，內含胃蛋白酶，並非鹼性分泌物。
Gastric juice contains hydrochloric acid, which is strongly acidic, and contains pepsin, so it is not an alkaline secretion.

唾液呈弱鹼性，內含澱粉酶（唾液澱粉酶），可消化澱粉。
Saliva is weakly alkaline and contains amylase (salivary amylase), which digests starch.

腸液和胰液皆屬鹼性，並含有多種消化酶（如蛋白酶、脂肪酶、澱粉酶），同時腸液含碳酸氫鈉，中和胃酸。
Intestinal juice and pancreatic juice are alkaline, both containing multiple digestive enzymes (e.g., proteases, lipases, amylases), and intestinal juice also contains sodium bicarbonate to neutralize stomach acid.

因此，答案為 D. 腸液和腸液。
Therefore, the answer is D. Pancreatic juice and intestinal juice.

📌考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
常見混淆點：膽汁雖然呈鹼性，但它 沒有消化酶，作用主要是乳化脂肪。
A common confusion: bile is alkaline, but it has no digestive enzymes; its main function is to emulsify fats.

胃液必須排除，因為它是強酸性，常跟「鹼性消化液」的提問相衝突。
Gastric juice must be excluded because it is strongly acidic, often the opposite of what “alkaline digestive juice” questions are asking.

考試時要牢記：

唾液 → 弱鹼性 + 澱粉酶
腸液/胰液 → 鹼性 + 多種酶
膽汁 → 鹼性但無酶
胃液 → 強酸性 + 蛋白酶
In exams, remember:
Saliva → weakly alkaline + amylase
Intestinal juice/pancreatic juice → alkaline + multiple enzymes
Bile → alkaline but no enzymes
Gastric juice → strongly acidic + protease

📌參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
答案：A

📌詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
血管 M 是肺動脈，將血液由心臟泵往肺部。
Vessel M is the pulmonary artery, which carries blood from the heart to the lungs.

血管 N 是肺靜脈，將血液由肺回流入左心房。
Vessel N is the pulmonary vein, which brings blood back from the lungs into the left atrium.

由於肺動脈需承受從右心室射出的高壓血液，其血管壁比肺靜脈厚。
Since the pulmonary artery must withstand the high pressure from the right ventricle, its vessel wall is thicker than that of the pulmonary vein.

血液成分方面：

流入肺之前（M）與流出肺之後（N）的血液在二氧化碳含量上有明顯差異；M 血 CO₂ 較多，N 血 CO₂ 較少。
對於尿素含量，兩者都未經過腎臟過濾，因此含量相同。
Regarding blood composition:
Before entering the lungs (M) vs after leaving the lungs (N), there is a difference in CO₂ content; vessel M blood has more CO₂, vessel N blood has less.
For urea content, both have the same amount because the blood has not yet passed through the kidneys.
因此，正確比較為：
M 管壁較厚，N 管壁較薄。
Therefore, the correct comparison is:
M has thicker walls, N has thinner walls.

📌考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
考試時遇到動脈與靜脈比較，要注意：肺循環是唯一「動脈含去氧血、靜脈含氧血」的例外。
In exams, when comparing arteries and veins, note that pulmonary circulation is the only exception where “arteries carry deoxygenated blood and veins carry oxygenated blood.”

釐清「血管壁厚度 → 與血壓高低相關；二氧化碳 → 取決於是否經過肺部氣體交換；尿素 → 需考慮腎臟過濾是否已發生」。
Clarify: “Vessel wall thickness → linked to blood pressure; CO₂ → depends on whether gas exchange at the lungs occurred; urea → depends on whether kidney filtration has taken place.”

不要被「尿素含量」干擾，因為肺循環未涉及腎臟，所以M與N的尿素水平相同。
Do not be misled by “urea content,” since pulmonary circulation does not involve the kidneys, so urea levels are the same in M and N.

📌參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
答案：D

📌詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
圖中 P 是房室瓣（左心房與左心室之間）。
In the diagram, P is the atrioventricular valve (between the left atrium and the left ventricle).

當 Y（左心室） 的肌肉收縮時，心室體積減少，導致內壓顯著上升。
When Y (left ventricle) contracts, its volume decreases, causing a sharp rise in internal pressure.

此時，Y 的壓力大於 X（左心房） 的壓力，壓差推動 P（房室瓣）關閉，防止血液回流至心房。
At this moment, the pressure in Y exceeds that in X (left atrium), and the pressure difference forces valve P to close, preventing backflow of blood into the atrium.

至於 Q（腱索） 的張力會隨着 P 的關閉而增加，但這是結果而非導致 P 關閉的主因。
As for Q (chordae tendineae), their tension increases as P closes, but this is a consequence rather than the primary cause of valve closure.

因此，正確答案是 D. 空腔 Y 內的壓力上升。
Therefore, the correct answer is D. An increase in pressure inside chamber Y.

📌考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
心臟瓣膜的開合，主要取決於「壓力差」，而不是肌肉或腱索本身的主動拉動。
The opening and closing of heart valves depend mainly on “pressure differences,” not on active pulling by muscles or chordae tendineae.

要牢記：

心房壓 > 心室壓 → 房室瓣開
心室壓 > 心房壓 → 房室瓣閉
Keep in mind:
Atrial pressure > Ventricular pressure → Atrioventricular valve opens
Ventricular pressure > Atrial pressure → Atrioventricular valve closes
命題陷阱經常利用「腱索張力」或「心肌主動運動」作干擾，但正確切入點永遠是「壓差」。
Exam questions often use “chordae tendineae tension” or “muscular action” as distractors, but the correct focus is always on “pressure difference.”

📌參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
答案：B（只有 (1) 和 (3)）

📌詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
圖中標示的 M 是 肺泡 (alveolus)。
The structure labelled M in the diagram is the alveolus.

(1) 表面積大：肺泡數量眾多，且具薄壁結構，可大大增加總表面積，促進氣體擴散。

(1) Large surface area: The numerous alveoli, with their thin walls, greatly increase the total surface area, enhancing gas diffusion.

(2) 壁上有纖毛：這是干擾選項。纖毛在 氣管及支氣管上皮 出現，功能是運送黏液和塵埃，不存在於肺泡。

(2) Presence of cilia: This is a distractor. Cilia are found in the trachea and bronchi epithelium, where they move mucus and dust particles, but are absent from alveoli.

(3) 有豐富的微血管供應：肺泡被大量毛細血管環繞，能快速輸入含氧血及帶走二氧化碳，維持濃度梯度以促進擴散。

(3) Rich capillary supply: Alveoli are surrounded by dense capillaries, allowing rapid oxygen uptake and carbon dioxide removal, maintaining steep diffusion gradients.

因此，正確答案是 (1) 與 (3)。
Therefore, the correct features are (1) and (3).

📌考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
常見誤區：以為「肺泡」也有纖毛。實際上，纖毛只在 輸送氣道 (氣管/支氣管/細支氣管)，不是在氣體交換部位。
Common pitfall: thinking that “alveoli” also have cilia. In fact, cilia are only present in the conducting airways (trachea/bronchi/bronchioles), not in gas exchange sites.

考試時，遇到「提高氣體擴散效率」的題目，重點通常是：

表面積大 (surface area)
膜薄 (thin barrier)
血液流速快/微血管供應多 (rich capillary supply / maintains diffusion gradient)
In exams, for “efficiency of gas exchange,” the key points are usually:
Large surface area
Thin barrier
Rich capillary supply / Rapid blood flow to maintain diffusion gradient

📌參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
答案：A（氮）
Answer: A (Nitrogen)

📌詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
大氣的主要成分是 氮氣（約 78%），其次是氧氣（約 21%）、二氧化碳和稀有氣體。
The main component of the atmosphere is nitrogen (~78%), followed by oxygen (~21%), carbon dioxide, and trace gases.

肺泡內的空氣來源於大氣，因此以氮氣為主，而氮氣並不參與氣體交換。
The air inside alveoli comes from the atmosphere, so nitrogen remains dominant, and it does not take part in gas exchange.

雖然肺泡會進行氧氣吸收與二氧化碳排出，但這只會稍微改變氧氣及二氧化碳的比例，不會影響氮氣作為主要成分的地位。
Although oxygen is absorbed and carbon dioxide is released in alveoli, this only slightly alters their relative proportions, without changing nitrogen as the main component.

因此，M（肺泡）內的氣體成分主要是 氮氣。
Therefore, the main gaseous component inside M (alveoli) is nitrogen.

📌考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
學生常誤以為肺泡內的空氣主要是氧氣，因為肺泡進行氣體交換。事實上，氧氣比例雖有降低或升高，但氮氣始終佔大多數。
Students often mistakenly think alveolar air is mainly oxygen because gas exchange occurs there. In fact, the proportion of oxygen may fluctuate, but nitrogen always makes up the majority.

考試時要記住：

氮氣 → 主體 (~78%) 且不參與氣體交換
氧氣 → 含量明顯比氮少
二氧化碳/水蒸氣 → 在肺泡內濃度相對大氣偏高，但仍非主要成分
In exams, remember:
Nitrogen → main component (~78%), not involved in gas exchange
Oxygen → significant but less than nitrogen
Carbon dioxide/water vapour → relatively higher in alveoli than in air, but not dominant

📌參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
答案：B（構造 M 的數目減少）
Answer: B (The number of structure M decreases)

📌詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
M 代表 肺泡 (alveolus)。
M represents the alveolus.

長期吸煙會破壞肺泡與肺泡之間的薄壁，使數個肺泡融合，形成較少但體積更大的肺氣腔。
Long-term smoking destroys the thin walls between alveoli, causing several alveoli to merge, resulting in fewer but larger air sacs.

這樣會大幅減少肺泡的總數量及總表面積，降低氣體交換效率。
This significantly reduces the total number and total surface area of alveoli, thereby lowering the efficiency of gas exchange.

另外，吸煙還會增加肺泡內的黏液分泌，阻塞部分肺泡，進一步削弱氧氣與二氧化碳的交換。
In addition, smoking increases mucus secretion inside alveoli, blocking some alveoli and further impairing oxygen and carbon dioxide exchange.

因此，長期吸煙的長遠影響是 肺泡數目減少。
Therefore, the long-term effect of smoking is a decrease in the number of alveoli.

📌考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
常見陷阱：

「體積減少」(A) → 錯，實際上單個肺氣腔變大，但肺泡數目變少。
「壁有皺摺/血液填滿」(C、D) → 圖表與病理不符，屬於干擾選項。
Common traps:
“Volume decreases” (A) → Wrong, as individual air sacs enlarge but the number of alveoli decreases.
“Folded walls / filled with blood” (C, D) → Not consistent with pathology, included only as distractors.
考試要記：
吸煙 → 破壞肺泡壁 → 肺泡融合 → 數目減少 → 表面積下降 → 氣體交換效率降低 → 容易導致 肺氣腫 (emphysema)。
In exams, remember:
Smoking → destroys alveolar walls → alveoli fuse → fewer in number → reduced surface area → lower gas exchange efficiency → leads to emphysema.

📌 參考答案 (Suggested Answer Opening)
答案：A. 酗酒的人
Answer: A. People who are addicted to alcohol

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
酒精中的毒素需要由肝臟分解，因此長期酗酒會大大增加肝臟的負擔。
The toxins in alcohol must be broken down by the liver, so long-term heavy drinking greatly increases the liver’s workload.

這會導致肝細胞受損，加速肝硬化及肝癌的形成。
This causes liver cell damage, leading to cirrhosis and a higher risk of liver cancer.

相比之下，糖尿病患者、吸煙習慣及體重問題雖然會影響其他器官，但與肝癌的直接關聯並不明顯。
In contrast, diabetes, smoking, or being overweight affect other organs mainly, but their direct correlation with liver cancer is weaker.

因此，酗酒人士患上肝癌的機會最高。
Therefore, people who abuse alcohol have the highest chance of developing liver cancer.

📝 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
此題考核重點是「風險因子與特定器官疾病的直接關聯」。
The key point in this question is the direct relationship between risk factors and specific organ diseases.

⚡ 提示：

認清肝臟是主要負責分解毒素的器官。
Remember that the liver is mainly responsible for detoxification.

任何「需經肝臟代謝的毒素（如酒精、藥物）」都會明顯加重肝臟負擔。
Any toxins that must be metabolized by the liver (e.g., alcohol, drugs) significantly increase liver workload.

閱讀題目時，注意「與肝臟直接相關」的選項，而非僅僅與健康有關。
When reading the question, focus on options directly related to the liver, not just general health.

📌 參考答案 (Suggested Answer Opening)
答案：C. 只有 (2) 和 (3)

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
(1) P 和 Q 各自有相同的染色體數目。
(1) P and Q each have the same number of chromosomes.

錯誤。因為 P（卵細胞）和 Q（精子）都是配子，屬於單倍體 (haploid)，所以他們的染色體數目相同，但題目問的是「所有細胞的染色體數目」而不是僅比 P 和 Q，因此該敘述不清晰且被判為錯誤。
Wrong. Both P (egg cell) and Q (sperm cell) are gametes and are haploid, so they do have the same chromosome number, but the statement is misleading because the question considers all the cells, not just P and Q. Hence it is considered incorrect.

(2) P 和 R 必定有一條 X 染色體。
(2) P and R must both contain one X chromosome.

正確。卵細胞一定含有 X 染色體，因為女性染色體組合是 XX。紅血球 R 由骨髓細胞分化而來，所以它的前體一定含 X 染色體（來自 XX 基因組）。
Correct. An egg cell must contain an X chromosome, since females are XX. Red blood cell R develops from bone marrow cells, which carry the normal XX genome, so its precursor must have an X chromosome.

(3) Q 和 S 必定有一條 Y 染色體。
(3) Q and S must both contain one Y chromosome.

正確。精子 Q 可能帶 X 或 Y 染色體，但只有帶 Y 的精子能決定雄性的性別，因此部分精子一定帶有 Y 染色體。S 為細胞核，來自男性體細胞，男性的染色體為 XY，所以其中必有一條 Y 染色體。
Correct. A sperm can carry either an X or Y chromosome, but those that determine male offspring carry Y. Since S is the nucleus of a somatic cell from a male body, and males are XY, it must contain a Y chromosome.

✅ 結論 (Conclusion)
因此，正確的選項是 只有 (2) 和 (3)。
Therefore, the correct statements are Only (2) and (3).

📝 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
要分清楚 單倍體與雙倍體：配子 (gametes) 是單倍體，體細胞 (somatic cells) 是雙倍體。
You must distinguish between haploid and diploid: gametes are haploid, somatic cells are diploid.

記得 性染色體分佈：

卵子 必定帶 X。
精子 可能帶 X 或 Y。
男性體細胞 = XY，女性體細胞 = XX。
Remember sex chromosome distribution:
Eggs always carry X.
Sperm may carry X or Y.
Male somatic cells = XY, Female somatic cells = XX.
看到「血細胞」時，不要忘了成熟紅血球雖然沒有細胞核，但其前體有完整染色體，所以要根據來源判斷。
When you see “red blood cells,” remember that mature RBCs lack a nucleus, but their precursors contain the full set of chromosomes, so think about the origin.

📌 參考答案 (Suggested Answer Opening)
答案：D. 血細胞R 吞噬細菌，血細胞S 產生抗體
Answer: D. Blood cell R engulfs bacteria, and blood cell S produces antibodies

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
血細胞 R 具有多葉的細胞核，屬於嗜中性白血球 (neutrophil)，主要功能是進行吞噬作用 (phagocytosis)。
Blood cell R has a multi-lobed nucleus and is a neutrophil (a type of white blood cell), whose main function is phagocytosis.

血細胞 S 具有大而圓的細胞核，屬於淋巴細胞 (lymphocyte)，可分化成漿細胞 (plasma cell)，負責產生抗體 (antibodies)。
Blood cell S has a large, round nucleus and is a lymphocyte, which can differentiate into a plasma cell and produce antibodies.

因此，正確答案是 R 吞噬細菌，S 產生抗體。
Therefore, the correct answer is R engulfs bacteria, S produces antibodies.

📝 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
白血球種類不同，功能各異：
Different types of white blood cells have different functions:

中性球 neutrophil → 吞噬細菌 (phagocytosis of bacteria)
淋巴球 lymphocyte (B cell) → 產生抗體 (antibody production)
考試時要注意細胞核形狀：
Pay attention to the shape of the nucleus in exams:

分葉核（lobed nucleus） → 吞噬細胞 (phagocyte)
大而圓的核（large round nucleus） → 淋巴球 (lymphocyte)
常見陷阱：不要把「產生抗毒素 (antitoxin)」和「產生抗體 (antibody)」混淆。
Common mistake: Don’t confuse “antitoxin production” with “antibody production.”

📌 參考答案 (Suggested Answer )
答案：D. 視錐細胞，黃斑
Answer: D. Cone cells, Yellow spot (fovea)

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
圖表顯示某種感光細胞在視網膜上的分布。
The graph shows the distribution of a certain type of photoreceptor cells across the retina.

區域 Q 有一個尖銳且高的峰值，表示該處有極高濃度的感光細胞。該區域是 黃斑中央窩 (fovea / yellow spot)。
Region Q shows a sharp, high peak, meaning an extremely high concentration of photoreceptors there. This region is the fovea (yellow spot).

黃斑中央窩只含 視錐細胞 (cone cells)，沒有視桿細胞 (rod cells)，負責高解像度與色覺。
The fovea contains only cone cells and no rod cells, enabling high visual acuity and color vision.

區域 P 則位於盲點 (blind spot)，此處沒有任何感光細胞。
Region P, however, is the blind spot, which lacks any photoreceptor cells.

因此，正確組合是 視錐細胞 (cone cells) + 黃斑 (yellow spot)。
Therefore, the correct combination is cone cells + yellow spot.

📝 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
視錐細胞 (Cone cells)：集中於黃斑，負責色覺及精細視覺，在強光下工作。
Cone cells: Concentrated in the fovea, responsible for color vision and detailed vision, function best in bright light.

視桿細胞 (Rod cells)：分佈於周邊視網膜，負責黑白視覺及弱光下的視覺，對光敏感但不能分辨顏色。
Rod cells: Distributed in the peripheral retina, responsible for black-and-white vision in dim light; very sensitive to light but cannot detect color.

盲點 (Blind spot)：視網膜上視神經離開眼球的位置，沒有任何感光細胞。
Blind spot: The point where the optic nerve exits the eye, contains no photoreceptors.

⚡ 考試陷阱：有些同學會把「盲點 (P)」誤以為是桿細胞聚集處，務必記得盲點完全沒有感光細胞！
⚡ Common trap: Some might think the “blind spot (P)” contains lots of rod cells — remember, it has no photoreceptors at all!

📌 參考答案 (Suggested Answer Opening)
答案：B. 沒有視覺產生
Answer: B. No vision is produced

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
光線聚焦於視網膜的區域 P 時，影像仍然會因折射作用而形成。
When light is focused onto region P of the retina, an image is still formed due to refraction.

然而，區域 P 為盲點 (blind spot)，沒有任何感光細胞 (rods 或 cones)。
However, region P is the blind spot, which contains no photoreceptor cells (neither rods nor cones).

因此，儘管能形成影像，卻無法將其轉化為神經訊息傳送至大腦，結果是 沒有視覺產生。
Therefore, even though an image is physically formed, it cannot be converted into nerve impulses for the brain, so no vision is produced.

📝 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
影像形成 ≠ 視覺產生。
Image formation ≠ Vision production.
光學影像可在視網膜任一位置形成，但是否有視覺，要視該處是否有感光細胞。
An optical image can form anywhere on the retina, but vision requires photoreceptor cells.

盲點 (blind spot)：視神經離開眼球的位置 → 完全沒有感光細胞 → 任何聚焦於此的光線都無法產生視覺。
Blind spot: The point where the optic nerve exits the eye → no photoreceptor cells at all → any image here produces no vision.

易混淆選項：
-「沒有影像形成」(A) 錯，因為光學影像仍然存在。
-「只產生黑白視覺 / 產生顏色視覺」(C/D) 亦錯，因為盲點上完全沒有感光細胞。
Confusing options:

“No image formed” (A) is wrong, because the optical image is still there.
“Only black-and-white vision” / “Color vision” (C/D) are also wrong, since no photoreceptors exist at the blind spot.

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)

📌 參考答案 (Suggested Answer Opening)
答案：A. 大腦 — 控制肌肉收縮；小腦 — 協調肌肉動作
Answer: A. Cerebrum — controls muscle contraction; Cerebellum — coordinates muscular movements

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
大腦負責控制隨意動作 (voluntary movements)，例如游泳時手腳主動划水的動作，需要靠大腦發出指令，刺激骨骼肌收縮。
The cerebrum controls voluntary movements, e.g., swimming strokes, where the brain sends conscious signals to skeletal muscles to contract.

小腦則負責協調這些隨意動作，確保四肢運動之間的平衡與流暢，讓游泳動作不會顫抖或失衡。
The cerebellum is responsible for coordinating these voluntary movements, ensuring smooth and balanced swimming motions.

至於心跳與血壓等不隨意功能，主要由延腦 (medulla oblongata) 控制，並非大腦或小腦的工作。
As for involuntary functions like heartbeat and blood pressure, these are controlled by the medulla oblongata, not the cerebrum or cerebellum.

因此，正確配搭是：大腦 → 控制肌肉收縮；小腦 → 協調肌肉動作。
Therefore, the correct match is: Cerebrum → controls muscle contraction; Cerebellum → coordinates muscle movement.

📝 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
大腦 (Cerebrum) → 隨意動作 (voluntary actions)、感覺、思考、記憶。
Cerebrum → Voluntary actions, sensation, thinking, memory.

小腦 (Cerebellum) → 協調動作 (coordination of movements)、平衡 (balance)。
Cerebellum → Coordination of movements, balance.

延腦 (Medulla oblongata) → 不隨意動作，如心跳、呼吸、血壓。
Medulla oblongata → Involuntary actions such as heartbeat, breathing, blood pressure.

⚡ 常見陷阱：有些學生會把「小腦」錯當成控制肌肉收縮的結構，記住小腦不會啟動動作，只是協調動作。
⚡ Common trap: Some students wrongly think the cerebellum initiates contractions; remember, it only coordinates, not commands.

📌 參考答案 (Suggested Answer Opening)
答案：B. 火山爆發後的演替
Answer: B. Succession after a volcanic eruption

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
原生演替 (Primary succession)：發生在一片原本沒有任何生物存在的地區，例如裸露的岩石或火山熔岩冷卻後的土地。原始環境沒有土壤與有機物，需要經過先鋒物種（如地衣、苔蘚）逐漸建立群落。
Primary succession: Occurs in an area that previously had no living organisms, such as bare rock or land formed by cooled lava after a volcanic eruption. There is no soil or organic matter initially, so pioneer species (e.g., lichens, mosses) gradually establish the ecosystem.

次生演替 (Secondary succession)：發生在原本已有群落，但後來遭到破壞的地區，例如廢棄農田、森林伐伐後、水澇退去後。此時土壤與部分生物仍然存在，所以演替速度較快。
Secondary succession: Happens in an area where a community previously existed but was disturbed (e.g., abandoned farmland, deforested areas, or after floods). Soil and some organisms remain, so the succession proceeds more quickly.

題目選項：

A 廢棄農田 → 有土壤和種子庫 → 屬於次生演替 (Secondary succession)。
A Abandoned farmland → soil and seed bank present → secondary succession.
B 火山爆發後 → 熔岩覆蓋，生物全滅 → 原生演替 (Primary succession)。
B After volcanic eruption → lava wipes out life, bare land remains → primary succession.
C 盡伐林木後 → 仍有土壤，可能還有小動物存活 → 次生演替。
C After deforestation → soil remains, life may persist → secondary succession.
D 水澇後 → 水退後土地仍有土壤和種子 → 次生演替。
D After flooding → soil and organisms remain → secondary succession.
因此，正確答案是 B 火山爆發後的演替。
Therefore, the correct answer is B. Succession after a volcanic eruption.

📝 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
關鍵分辨點：

原生演替：一開始 沒有土壤、沒有生物。
次生演替：一開始 仍有土壤或殘存生物。
Key distinction:
Primary succession: no soil, no life at the beginning.
Secondary succession: soil and some life remain.
⚡ 常考陷阱：
許多學生會誤以為「廢棄農田、伐林後」屬於原生演替，其實它們有完整土壤，應算作次生演替。
Common trap: Students mistakenly think “abandoned farmland or deforested land” are primary succession — but since soil exists, they are secondary.

📌 參考答案 (Suggested Answer)
答案：D. 分解者
Answer: D. Decomposer

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
圖中 Z 連接「遺骸 (dead organic matter)」，並且能把遺體中的能量流動回食物鏈。
In the diagram, Z is connected to “dead organic matter (detritus)” and channels energy back into the food chain.

這正是分解者 (decomposer) 的角色，例如細菌和真菌，將有機遺體分解為無機物，並釋放能量供其他生物利用。
This is exactly the role of decomposers (e.g., bacteria and fungi), which break down organic remains into inorganic materials and release energy for other organisms to use.

其他選項為何錯誤：
Other options explained:

A 捕食者 (Predator)：以活的獵物為食，Z 吃的是遺骸，並非活生物。
Predator: feed on living prey, but Z consumes dead matter, not living organisms.
B 病原體 (Pathogen)：使生物致病，與遺骸能量分解無關。
Pathogen: cause disease in living organisms, unrelated to decomposition of dead matter.
C 寄生物 (Parasite)：依附在宿主身體上吸收養分，需以活生物為對象，不適用於遺骸。
Parasite: derive nutrients from a living host, not from dead remains.
所以，正確答案為 分解者 (Decomposer)。
Thus, the correct answer is Decomposer.

📝 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
分解者 (decomposer)：主要處理死去的有機物（遺骸、糞便），將其分解成無機營養鹽。
Decomposers: mainly act on dead organic matter (remains, feces), releasing inorganic nutrients.

捕食者 predator / 寄生者 parasite / 病原體 pathogen → 都需要活的生物體來生存。
Predators / parasites / pathogens → all require living organisms.

⚡ 考試陷阱：看到「遺骸 (remains)」或「糞便 (faeces)」時，要馬上聯想到「分解者」。
⚡ Exam trap: When you see “remains” or “faeces,” immediately think of “decomposer.”

📌 參考答案 (Suggested Answer Opening)
答案：B. 呼吸作用
Answer: B. Respiration

📖 詳細解釋 (Detailed Explanation)
在能量流動圖中，過程 2 代表能量從生態系統中以熱的形式流失。
In the energy flow diagram, process 2 refers to energy loss from the ecosystem in the form of heat.

這是因為所有生物進行呼吸作用 (respiration) 時，不僅將部分能量轉化為 ATP，還會以熱能形式散失。
This happens because in respiration, organisms convert some energy into ATP, but part of it is always lost as heat.

其他選項為何錯誤：
Why the other options are incorrect:

A 排泄作用 (Egestion)：將未消化的食物排出體外，能量損失極小，非主要能量流失來源。
Egestion: eliminates undigested food, energy loss is minor.
C 蒸騰作用 (Transpiration)：只發生於植物，屬於水分散失，與能量流失關係不大。
Transpiration: occurs only in plants, involves water loss, not major energy loss.
D 分解作用 (Decomposition)：發生於遺骸及糞便，並非能量在食物鏈各層次中普遍的流失方式。
Decomposition: happens in dead matter, not the universal energy loss in every trophic level.
因此，正確答案是 呼吸作用 (Respiration)。
Therefore, the correct answer is Respiration.

📝 考試提醒 (Exam Tips)
能量流失的最大途徑 = 呼吸作用產生的熱能。
The main pathway of energy loss = heat released during respiration.

陷阱提醒：

蒸騰作用 (C) 常被誤選，但它是「水分」流失，不是能量的主要流失途徑。
分解作用 (D) 與死物有關，而不是每一個生物層次都會發生的過程。
Common trap:
Transpiration (C) = water loss, not dominant energy loss.
Decomposition (D) = from dead matter, not universal to all trophic levels.

📌 參考答案
A. 1°

📌 詳細解釋
題目探討能量在生態系中的流動方向。
The question examines the flow of energy within an ecosystem.

由圖可見，X 為食性層次中的某一群生物，能量可經不同途徑流出。
From the diagram, X represents a trophic level through which energy leaves via several pathways.

「1」表示由 X 流向 Y 的能量 (如下一食性層消耗)，
“1” represents energy flow from X to Y (as the next trophic level consumes X),

而「2」為呼吸作用損失的能量。
while “2” represents energy lost through respiration.

「3」是由 X 透過進食或同化傳向 W 的能量。
“3” indicates energy transferred to W through feeding or assimilation.

「4」表示生物死亡後經遺骸進入分解者 Z 的能量。
“4” indicates energy transferred to decomposers (Z) after the death of organisms.

由於經過呼吸 (2) 和死亡 (4) 的能量已散失，
Since energy lost through respiration (2) and death (4) is no longer available,

在所有能量流動中，流向下一食性層 (1) 的能量數值最大，
among all energy transfers, the flow towards the next trophic level (1) is the largest,

故最大能量流動見於 1°。
thus the greatest energy flow is observed at 1°.

📌 考試提醒
能量流動方向：由生產者 → 消費者 → 分解者。
Direction of energy flow: from producers → consumers → decomposers.

每經一層轉移，能量急遽減少 (通常僅約10%傳遞)。
At each transfer, energy decreases sharply (only about 10% is passed on).

呼吸與死亡造成能量散佈，無法再被利用。
Energy is lost through respiration and death, and cannot be reused.

最大能量流動永遠在活體之間的攝食關係中。
The greatest energy flow always occurs between living organisms in feeding relationships.

📌 參考答案
D. (1)、(2) 和(3)

📌 詳細解釋
控制色覺的基因位於 X 染色體上。
The gene controlling colour vision is located on the X chromosome.

所有有細胞核的細胞都含有相同的染色體組，所以也具有同一組基因。
All nucleated cells contain the same set of chromosomes, and therefore the same set of genes.

(1) 眼細胞 有細胞核，因此擁有該性連遺傳基因。
(1) Eye cells have nuclei, so they contain the sex-linked gene.

(2) 卵子 是生殖細胞，亦帶有 X 染色體上的基因。
(2) Egg cells are gametes that also carry the gene on the X chromosome.

(3) 肝細胞 雖與視覺無關，但因為有細胞核，也含有此基因。
(3) Liver cells, though unrelated to vision, also have nuclei and therefore contain the same gene.

這說明即使不同細胞有相同的基因，它們的基因表達會因開啟或關閉而不同。
This explains why cells with identical genes can differ in gene expression, depending on which genes are activated or repressed.

➡ 所以，控制色覺的性連遺傳基因可見於 (1)、(2) 和 (3)。
➡ Therefore, the gene controlling colour vision is found in (1), (2), and (3).

📌 考試提醒
每個有細胞核的細胞都擁有完整的基因組。
Every nucleated cell possesses the complete set of genes.

細胞之間的差異來自於不同的基因表達，而非缺少某些基因。
Differences between cells arise from gene expression, not from missing genes.

生殖細胞如卵子或精子雖為單倍體，但仍含有性連遺傳基因。
Gametes such as eggs or sperm are haploid but still carry sex-linked genes.

✳ 記憶法：有細胞核 → 有基因；基因相同 → 表達不同。
✳ Memory tip: Nucleus present → gene present; same genes → different expression.

📌 參考答案
C. 2

📌 詳細解釋
題目提供一條 DNA 模板鏈：
The question provides a DNA template strand:

DNA 模板: 5′–CCGGGCGCAGGCACG–3′
DNA template: 5′–CCGGGCGCAGGCACG–3′

轉錄時，mRNA 的核苷酸序列與 DNA 模板互補（A↔U，T↔A，G↔C，C↔G）。
During transcription, the mRNA sequence is complementary to the DNA template (A↔U, T↔A, G↔C, C↔G).

因此得到的 mRNA 序列 為：
Therefore, the synthesized mRNA sequence is:

3′–GGCCCGCGUCCGUGC–5′
3′–GGCCCGCGUCCGUGC–5′

從 5′ 端至 3′ 端，可分為 5 個密碼子 (codons)：
Reading from 5′ to 3′, we get five codons:

GGC – CCG – CGU – CCG – UGC

其中 CCG 是編碼「脯胺酸 (proline)」的密碼子。
Among these, CCG codes for the amino acid proline.

序列中出現了 兩次 CCG，代表有兩個脯胺酸分子。
The sequence shows two CCG codons, meaning two proline residues are produced.

➡ 所以正確答案是 2。
➡ Therefore, the correct answer is 2.

📌 考試提醒
DNA 模板鏈與 mRNA 互補且方向相反。
The DNA template strand is complementary and antiparallel to mRNA.

轉錄配對規則：A→U、T→A、G→C、C→G。
Base pairing in transcription: A→U, T→A, G→C, C→G.

每三個鹼基 (codon) 編一個胺基酸。
Every three bases (a codon) code for one amino acid.

記住常見胺基酸密碼子：
Remember example codons:

CCG → Proline (脯胺酸)
AUG → Methionine (起始密碼子)
UAA/UAG/UGA → 終止密碼子 (stop codons)
✳ 小貼士：看到同一密碼子重複出現 → 胺基酸重複出現。
✳ Quick tip: Same codon appears multiple times → same amino acid appears multiple times.

C. (2) 和 (3)

📌 詳細解釋
人類男性的性染色體組合是 XY。
Human males have the sex chromosome pair XY.

在減數分裂形成精子時，X 與 Y 兩條染色體會分裂到不同的配子中。
During meiosis, the X and Y chromosomes separate into different gametes.

因此，精子中一半帶 X 染色體，一半帶 Y 染色體。
Thus, half the sperm carry an X chromosome, and half carry a Y chromosome.

另一方面，每一卵子皆帶有 1 條 X 染色體。
On the other hand, every ovum carries one X chromosome.

精子與卵子的結合是隨機的 (random fusion)，
The fusion of sperm and egg is random,

所以帶 X 的精子與卵子結合會形成女性 (XX)，
so an X-bearing sperm fusing with an ovum produces a female (XX),

而帶 Y 的精子與卵子結合會形成男性 (XY)。
while a Y-bearing sperm produces a male (XY).

由於 X 精子與 Y 精子數量相等，且結合為隨機事件，
Since there are equal numbers of X and Y sperm and fertilization is random,

生男與生女的機會即為 1:1。
the probability of having a boy or a girl is 1:1.

📌 考試提醒
(1) 每顆卵子只被一顆精子受精，這是自然常規，並非形成 1:1 比例的關鍵。
(1) Each ovum is fertilized by one sperm, which is normal but not the cause of the 1:1 ratio.

(2) 結合是隨機的 → male/female 發生機率相同。
(2) Random fertilization → equal chance for male or female zygote.

(3) 男性產生 X 與 Y 精子數目相同 → 性別比維持 1:1。
(3) Males produce equal numbers of X- and Y-bearing sperm → maintains a 1:1 sex ratio.

生男生女機會取決於「父親的精子攜帶何種性染色體」，不是母親的卵子。
✳ Quick tip:
The baby’s sex depends on which sex chromosome the father’s sperm carries, not the mother’s egg.

The graph shows the average increase in body mass (kg) of females across age.

曲線最斜的部分代表身體質量增長最快的階段。

The slope of a growth curve indicates the rate of growth.

斜率越大 → 生長越快；

A steeper slope → faster growth;

斜率變平 → 生長速度減慢或停滯。
a flatter slope → slower or no growth.

Puberty is the period of most rapid growth, usually between ages 11–14 for females.

當皮膚受到細菌感染時，感染部位的小動脈會舒張。
When the skin is infected by bacteria, the small arteries at the infected site dilate.

毛細血管的通透性增加，使更多血漿成分滲出到周圍組織中。
The permeability of capillaries increases, allowing more plasma components to leak into surrounding tissues.

這些滲出的液體在組織間積聚，形成組織液 (tissue fluid)。
This fluid accumulates in the intercellular spaces, forming tissue fluid.

由於組織液聚集導致局部腫脹，因此我們看到感染部位隆起發脹。
As tissue fluid builds up, the area becomes swollen and raised.

這種現象屬於炎症反應的一部分。
This swelling is part of the inflammatory response.

👉 故正確答案為 C. 組織液積聚。
👉 Therefore, the correct answer is C. accumulation of tissue fluid.

📌 考試提醒
A. 大量細菌遭殺掉 → 可發生，但不是腫脹原因。

A. Many bacteria killed → occurs, but not the cause of swelling.

B. 微血管擴張 → 錯誤，毛細血管並非有平滑肌，不能「擴張」。

B. Capillary dilation → incorrect, capillaries lack smooth muscle so cannot actively dilate.

D. 抗體濃度增加 → 屬於免疫反應的一部分，但非導致腫脹的直接原因。

D. Increase in antibody concentration → part of immune defense, not directly responsible for swelling.

✳ 重點記憶：感染 → 微血管通透性↑ → 組織液滲出↑ → 腫脹。
✳ Key concept: infection → capillary permeability ↑ → tissue fluid leakage ↑ → swelling.

B. 血友病

📌 詳細解釋
霍亂、肺結核及腳癬皆為傳染病，
Cholera, tuberculosis, and athlete’s foot are all infectious diseases,

可透過改善個人衛生習慣（如勤洗手、煮熟食物、保持乾爽）來預防。
and can be prevented through good hygiene practices (e.g. washing hands, cooking food thoroughly, keeping feet dry).

然而，血友病 (haemophilia) 是由基因突變引起的遺傳病，
However, haemophilia is an inherited disorder caused by a gene mutation,

使患者缺乏凝血因子，導致出血時間延長。
which leads to a deficiency of clotting factors, causing prolonged bleeding.

此病無法藉由個人衛生來避免或預防。
This disease cannot be prevented by personal hygiene.
